daae: <entryFree id="n12246" type="main" key="Da^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dăae</orth>, v. Dahae.</entryFree>
dabanegorisregio: <entryFree id="n12247" type="main" key="Dabanegoris Re^gio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dabanegoris Rĕgio</orth>, <sense id="n12247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dabar: <entryFree id="n12248" type="main" key="Dabar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dabar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Numidian, a relative of Masinissa and an intimate friend of Bocchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 108</bibl> and 109. <cb n="DAED" /></sense></entryFree>
dabla: <entryFree id="n12249" type="foreign" key="dabla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dabla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Arab. word</etym>, <sense id="n12249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Arabian palm, which bears a delicious fruit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daci: <entryFree id="n12250" type="main" key="Da_ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dakoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n12250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Dacians</hi>, a famous warlike people, akin to the Thracians. They occupied what is now Upper Hungary, Transylvania, Moldavia, Wallachia, Bessarabia. Subdued by Trajan, they received Roman civilization, and thence retain in part the name Rumanians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 53</bibl> et saep. In <number>sing.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dācus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Dacian</hi> (usually <hi rend="ital">collect.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 497</bibl>; cf. Voss. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 35, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12250.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12250.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*daki/a</foreign>, the province <hi rend="ital">Dacia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Regn. Succ. p. 59, 52 al.</bibl>: DACIA. APVLENSIS. (of the colony Apulum or Alba Julia, near Carlsburg), Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3888: (DECIO) RESTITVTORI DACIARVM, ib. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 991. A part of it bordering on the Danube was <hi rend="ital">Dacia Aureliani</hi>, Eutrop. 9, 15; and <hi rend="ital">Dacia Ripensis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Regn. Succ. p. 59, 51</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12250.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dacian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit> (written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dacius</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:Cons. ad Liv. 387" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> Cons. ad Liv. 387</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n12250.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dācĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dacian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 1, 272</bibl></cit>. As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Da-cicus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus), <hi rend="ital">a piece of gold coined under Domitian, the conqueror of the Dacians</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12250.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāciscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dacian</hi>, imperium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Pers. 27, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dacrima: <entryFree id="n12251" type="gloss" key="da^cri^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăcrĭma</orth>, v. lacrima.</entryFree>
dactyli: <entryFree id="n12252" type="main" key="Dacty^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dactyli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. dactylus, <sense id="n12252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> VII.</sense></entryFree>
dactylicus: <entryFree id="n12253" type="greek" key="dacty^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dactylĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">daktuliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dactylic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57</bibl></cit>: pes, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 209: <cit><quote lang="la">metra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1820</bibl></cit> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 494</bibl></cit> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
dactyliotheca: <entryFree id="n12254" type="greek" key="dacty^li^o^the_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dactylĭŏthēca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">daktulioqh/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n12254.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A casket to keep rings in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:59:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:123" default="NO">14, 123</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">title</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n12254.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a collection of seal-rings and jewels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 5, § 11</bibl>; Caesaris, Murat. Inscr. 907, 3.</sense></entryFree>
dactylis: <entryFree id="n12255" type="main" key="dacty^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dactylis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape;</hi> cf. the following, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>
dactylus: <entryFree id="n12256" type="greek" key="dacty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dactylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulos</foreign> (<sense id="n12256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finger</hi>, hence meton.). </sense><sense id="n12256.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of muscle</hi>: "ab humanorum unguium similitudine appellati," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 61, 87, § 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12256.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dacty-lis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12256.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of grass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 119, § 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12256.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12256.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The date</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:1 al" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 1 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n12256.6" n="VI" level="1"> In metre, a <hi rend="ital">dactyl</hi>, ¯ <cit><quote lang="la">˘ ˘ (in allusion to the three joints of the finger),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 81</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12256.7" n="VII" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dactyli Idaei</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/ktuloi *)idai=oi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a mythic body of men originally placed on Mt. Ida, in Phrygia, afterwards in the island of Crete; priests of Cybele, and as such regarded as identical with the</hi> Corybantes, <hi rend="ital">and with the Samothracian Cabiri</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 474</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 197</bibl> (in pure Lat., Idaei Digiti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
dacus: <entryFree id="n12257" type="main" key="Da_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Daci, <sense id="n12257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</sense></entryFree>
dadastana: <entryFree id="n12258" type="main" key="Da^dasta^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dădastăna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Bithynia, near the borders of Galatia; here the Emperor Jovian died</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> Marc. 25, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 23</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dadastă-nae</orth>, <itype>arum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Regn. Succ. p. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daduchus: <entryFree id="n12259" type="main" key="da_du_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dādūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da|dou=xos</foreign>, <sense id="n12259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the torch - bearer.—Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dādūchi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Ceres</hi> (Demeter) <hi rend="ital">at Eleusis, who guided the initiated with torches to the temple on the fifth day of the Mysteries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Verr. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Verr. 1</bibl>; Fabrett. Inscr. 676, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 29.</sense></entryFree>
daedala: <entryFree id="n12260" type="main" key="Daeda^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daedăla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dai/dala</foreign>. <sense id="n12260.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fortified place in Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 29, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 22, 3</bibl>.—Hence, insulae Daedaleae, <hi rend="ital">two small islands off the coast of Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12260.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a region in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 19</bibl>; cf. Daedali montes, Justin. 12, 7.</sense></entryFree>
daedale: <entryFree id="n12261" type="main" key="daeda^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daedăle</orth>, <sense id="n12261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., artistically, skilfully</hi>, v. 1, daedalus, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
daedalion: <entryFree id="n12262" type="main" key="Daeda^li^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daedălĭōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*daidali/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n12262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="510" /> <cb n="DAHA" /> <hi rend="ital">king of Trachis, son of Lucifer, and brother of Ceyx, who was changed into a hawk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:295 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 295 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
daedalus: <entryFree id="n12262.1" type="greek" key="daeda^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daedălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dai/dalos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">artificial, skilful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose). <sense id="n12262.2" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: Minerva, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 6</bibl> Müll. (Fr. Inc. Lib. xxi. Vahl.): daedalam a varietate rerum artificiorumque dictam esse apud Lucretium terram, apud Ennium Minervam, apud Vergilium Circen, facile est intellegere, cum Graece <foreign lang="greek">daida/llein</foreign> significet variare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68</bibl> Müll.: Circe ("<hi rend="ital">ingeniosa</hi>," Serv.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 282</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12262.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum daedala lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>the fashioner of words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 549</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura daedala rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 234</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12262.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., artificially contrived, variously adorned, ornamented</hi>, etc., <foreign lang="greek">daida/leos</foreign>: tecta (apium), <hi rend="ital">skilfully constructed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>variegated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:228" default="NO" valid="yes">228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 179</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina chordis,</quote> <trans><tr>artfully varied on strings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 505</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">daedăle</orth>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, Jul. Val. Res gest. A. M. 3, 86.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12263" type="main" key="Daeda^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daedălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n12263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. Gr.</hi> Daedalon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 49</bibl>), <foreign lang="greek">*dai/dalos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n12263.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mythical Athenian architect of the times of Theseus and Minos, father of Icarus, and builder of the Cretan labyrinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 39" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:49:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 49, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:89 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 89 sq.</bibl>, et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12263.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12263.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daedălē^us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Daedalian, relating to Daedalus</hi>: </sense><sense id="n12263.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Daedălēo Icaro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 20, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ope Daedălēa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12263.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Daedalĕum iter (i. e. <hi rend="ital">through the labyrinth</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 8</bibl> (3, 6, 8 M.).—* </sense><sense id="n12263.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daedălĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., skilful</hi>: manus, Venant. 10, 11, 17.—</sense><sense id="n12263.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A later sculptor of Sicyon, son and pupil of Patrocles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipse inter fictores laudatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
daemon: <entryFree id="n12263.8" type="greek" key="daemon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dai/mwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a spirit</hi>, genius, lar (post-class.). <sense id="n12263.9" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 49, 5</bibl>: bonus = <foreign lang="greek">a)gaqodai/mwn</foreign>, in astrology, <hi rend="ital">the last but one of the twelve celestial signs</hi>, Firm. Math. 2, 19: melior, Jul. Val. Res gest. A. M. 1, 27.—</sense><sense id="n12263.10" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. writers: <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an evil spirit, demon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jacob. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>, et saep.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12264" type="main" key="Daemon2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Greek sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daemones: <entryFree id="n12265" type="main" key="Daemo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daemŏnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an old man, a character in the Rudens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:Prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. Prol. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 7, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daemoniacus: <entryFree id="n12266" type="greek" key="daemo^ni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daemŏnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">daimoniako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to an evil spirit, demoniac, devilish</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n12266.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12266.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">daemoniacus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a demoniac, one possessed by an evil spirit</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6; Sulpic. Sever. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daemonicola: <entryFree id="n12267" type="hapax" key="daemo^ni^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daemŏnĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>daemon-colo</etym>, <sense id="n12267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of devils, a heathen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daemonicus: <entryFree id="n12268" type="greek" key="daemo^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daemŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">daimoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to an evil spirit, demoniac, devilish</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 58</bibl></cit>: aras coli, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 36: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 13, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
daemonium: <entryFree id="n12269" type="greek" key="daemo^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daemŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">daimo/nion</foreign>. <sense id="n12269.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lesser divinity, a little spirit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 938</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12269.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An evil spirit, demon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:page=32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. p. 32, 17</bibl>; Psa. 95, 5 et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
daesitiatae: <entryFree id="n12270" type="main" key="Daesi^ti^a_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daesĭtĭātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the south of Pannonia Superior</hi>, Pl. 3, 22, 26, § 143; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Pat. 2:115" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> Pat. 2, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dagnades: <entryFree id="n12271" type="gloss" key="dagnades"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dagnades</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of birds in Egypt</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 15</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dahae: <entryFree id="n12272" type="main" key="Da^hae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dăhae</orth> (less correctly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daae</orth>, v. Bramb. s. v.), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/ai</foreign>, <sense id="n12272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian tribe beyond the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:16 al" default="NO">16 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 728</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:429" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 429</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:764" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 764</bibl>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">*da/oi</foreign>, Herod. 1, 125; Strab. p. 304; Ritter, Erdk. 7, 627 sq.; 668 sq.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dăhă</orth>, Prud. contr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:807" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 807</bibl>. <cb n="DAMA" /></sense></entryFree>
dahippus: <entryFree id="n12273" type="main" key="Da^hippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dăhippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/i+ppos</foreign>, <sense id="n12273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor, son and pupil of Lysippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daiphron: <entryFree id="n12274" type="main" key="Daiphron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daïphron</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dai/frwn</foreign>, <sense id="n12274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dalion: <entryFree id="n12275" type="main" key="Dalion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalion</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n12275.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12275.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dalivus: <entryFree id="n12276" type="gloss" key="dalivus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dalivus</orth>, a word of unknown signif.; acc. to some, = <sense id="n12276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supinus;</hi> acc. to others, = <hi rend="ital">stultus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insanus</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:68:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 68, 1</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dalmatae: <entryFree id="n12277" type="main" key="Dalma^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalmătae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delmătae</orth> (so very often in the best MSS. and inscrr., and on coins; cf. Vel. Long. p. 2233; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2287</bibl>, and Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 1, 16</bibl>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dalma/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n12277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Dalmatians, on the eastern coast of the Adriatic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>; Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1833; 3037 al.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.: montes Dalmatae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12277.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12277.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalmătĭa (Delm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dalmati/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country on the eastern coast of the Adriatic Sea, Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 141</bibl>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:76 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 76 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Pat. 2:39:90" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> Pat. 2, 39, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 2, 78</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12277.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalmătĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Delm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dalmatian</hi>: frigus, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: miles, id. H., 2, 86; <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Dalmatian gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:153" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 153</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12277.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalmătĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (sc. vestis), <hi rend="ital">a long undergarment of Dalmatian wool, worn by priests during the mass</hi>, Edict. Diocl. 16, 4; 17, 1; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12277.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalmătĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Delm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., clothed in such a garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Elag. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12277.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dal-mătĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Delm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">surname of</hi> L. Metellus (cons. A. U. 635), <hi rend="ital">on account of his victories over the Dalmatians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 2:1:59:section=154" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12277.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dalmătensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Delm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dalmatian</hi>: Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dama: <entryFree id="n12278" type="main" key="da_ma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dāma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. damma.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12279" type="main" key="Da_ma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">101</bibl>; 2, 7, 54.</sense></entryFree>
damalio: <entryFree id="n12280" type="greek" key="da^ma^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dămălĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">da/malos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n12280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calf</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sever. 22, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damalis: <entryFree id="n12281" type="main" key="Da^ma^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dămălis</orth> <itype>is</itype> (is or ĭdis, acc. to Probus, p. 124 Lindem.), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 36, 13 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
damascus: <entryFree id="n12282" type="main" key="Da^mascus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dămascus</orth> (-os, Luc 3, 215; cf. Prob. II. p. 1462 <sense id="n12282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> P., p. 121 Lindem.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*damasko/s</foreign>, Heb. <hi rend="ital">Dammesek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Darmesek, the very ancient capital of Coelesyria, on the Chrysorrhoas, celebrated for its terebinths, and, since the time of the Emperor Diocletian, for its fabrics in steel, now Dameshk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 18, 16, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:29" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12282.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Damascus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Damascus</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12282.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dăma-scēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Damascus, Damascene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:29" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 29</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">absol.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:18:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 18, 3</bibl></cit> (Eng. <hi rend="ital">damson</hi>); <cit><quote lang="la">and pruna Damasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:404" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 404</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12282.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n12282.4" n="1" level="3"> <itype>DAMASCENVS, i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, </sense><sense id="n12282.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">a surname of Juppiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 20, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12282.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.: the people of Damascus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12282.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dămascēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. regio), <hi rend="ital">the region about Damascus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>; in the Greek form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Damascene</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damasichthon: <entryFree id="n12283" type="main" key="Da^ma^sichtho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dămăsichthōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*damasi/xqwn</foreign>, <sense id="n12283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Amphion and Niobe, slain by Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:254 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 254 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
damasippus: <entryFree id="n12284" type="main" key="Da^ma^sippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dămăsippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dama/sippos</foreign> (tamer of horses), <sense id="n12284.0" n="I" level="1"> Prætor 672 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">a follower of Marius, who acted with great cruelty towards the adherents of Sylla; afterwards put to death by order of Sylla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12284.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname in the</hi> gens Licinia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12284.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a bankrupt merchant and ridiculous Stoic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 16</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n12284.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of an actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damasonion: <entryFree id="n12285" type="greek" key="damaso_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damasōnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <sense id="n12285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">n</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">damasw/nion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> = alisma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 77, § 124</bibl>. <cb n="DAMN" /></sense></entryFree>
damium: <entryFree id="n12286" type="gloss" key="da_mium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dāmium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: sacrificium, quod fie bat in operto in honorem Bonae Deae. Dea quoque ipsa DAMIA et sacerdos ejus DAMIATRIX appellabatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 8</bibl> Müll [<foreign lang="greek">da=mos</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">dh=mos</foreign>]; cf. "damium, <foreign lang="greek">qusi/ai u(pai/qrioi gino/menai</foreign>," Gloss. Lab.</entryFree>
damiurgus: <entryFree id="n12287" type="main" key="da_mi^urgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dāmĭurgus</orth>, v. demiurgus.</entryFree>
damma: <entryFree id="n12288" type="main" key="damma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dama</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Ec. 8, 28</bibl>; Georg. 3, 539; A. 8, 641; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:408" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 408</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 6</bibl>) [R. dam-, v. domo], a general name for beasts of the deer kind; <sense id="n12288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fallow deer, buck, doe, antelope, chamois</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 308</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 410</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 442</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 539</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 832</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:646" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 646</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 62" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12288.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">venison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil damma sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 832</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dammula: <entryFree id="n12289" type="main" key="dammu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dammŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, v. damula.</entryFree>
damnabilis: <entryFree id="n12290" type="main" key="damna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>damno</etym>, <sense id="n12290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of condemnation, damnable</hi> (late Lat. for damnandus, or dignus qui damnetur): <cit><quote lang="la">invidia, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 17: res (with turpes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mea ipsa verba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by my own rule</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin. Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">damnābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">culpably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damnas: <entryFree id="n12291" type="main" key="damnas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnas</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <etym>do, v. damnum</etym>, <sense id="n12291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bound to make a gift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contribution</hi>, hence an old legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">condemned, sentenced</hi> to do any thing (esp. to pay a fine). </sense><sense id="n12291.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <number>sing.</number>: TANTVM AES DARE DOMINO DAMNAS ESTO, Lex Aquilia in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl>; so, damnas esto dare illi omnia, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>; Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 4425 and 4428; Tab. Heracl. ap. Harbold. Mon. Leg. p. 104: S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12291.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem dare damnas sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:122" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:34:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32, 34, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damnaticius: <entryFree id="n12292" type="main" key="damna_tici^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnāticĭus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>damno</etym>, <sense id="n12292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">condemned, sentenced</hi>: "<foreign lang="greek">*kata/kriton</foreign> damnaticium," Gloss. Gr. Lat. (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">etsi nihil de damnaticiis participarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Haeret. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
damnatio: <entryFree id="n12293" type="main" key="damna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">condemnation</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n12293.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12293.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(video) omnes damnatos, omnes ignominia affectos, omnes damnatione ignominiaque dignos illuc facere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est illa damnatione judicatum, nisi, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si damnatio ingruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> A, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi damnationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61 al.</bibl></cit>—In eccl. Lat. esp. of <hi rend="ital">the displeasure of God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum damnatio justa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: reorum acerbissimae damnationes (<hi rend="ital">opp.</hi> libidinosissimae liberationes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the offence: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 98</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the punishment: tantae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">accus.</hi> of the punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">ad furcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis ad carnificinam, dei ad poenam sempiternam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">animarum ad aeterna supplicia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12293.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. with reference to the meaning of damnas (v. h. v.): <hi rend="ital">an heir's obligation to pay</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12293.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">apiastrum in confessa damnatione est venenatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
damnator: <entryFree id="n12294" type="main" key="damna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who condemns</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnator Christi frater iniquus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Hymn. 1, 10 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
damnatorius: <entryFree id="n12295" type="main" key="damna_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>damnator</etym>, <sense id="n12295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">damnatory, condemnatory</hi> (rare, but good prose): judicium, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 22</bibl>: d. et absolutoria tabella, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
damnatus: <entryFree id="n12296" type="main" key="damna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>damno</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
damnaustra: <entryFree id="n12297" type="gloss" key="damnaustra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnaustra</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ dannaustra</orth>, <itype>words of a charm to cure a dislocated joint</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:160" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 160</bibl>.</entryFree>
damnifico: <entryFree id="n12298" type="main" key="damni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to injure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eccl. Lat.) aliquem pecuniis,</quote> <trans><tr>to fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
damnificus: <entryFree id="n12299" type="main" key="damni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>damnumfacio</etym>, <sense id="n12299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">injurious, hurtful, pernicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnificum est aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
damnigerulus: <entryFree id="n12300" type="hapax" key="damni^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnĭgĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>damnum-gero</etym>, <sense id="n12300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">injurious, pernicious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damno: <entryFree id="n12301" type="main" key="damno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damno</orth> (in vulg. lang. and late Lat. sometimes dampno), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>damnum</etym>. <sense id="n12301.0" n="I" level="1"> Gen., <hi rend="ital">to occasion loss or damage to, to harm, damage</hi> = damno <pb n="511" /> <cb n="DAMN" /> afficere: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperibus parcere, divites damnare atque domare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12301.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. [cf. damnum, II.] a judicial t. t., <hi rend="ital">to condemn, doom, sentence one to any punishment</hi> = condemno, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 166</bibl> (opp. to absolvere, liberare, dimittere; cf. also condemno, culpo, improbo; common and classical).—Constr. with <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">person</hi>, either alone or with <hi rend="ital">gen., abl., de, in, ad</hi>, etc., of the crime and punishment: damnatur aliquis <hi rend="ital">crimine</hi> vel <hi rend="ital">judicio</hi>, sed <hi rend="ital">sceleris, parricidii</hi>, etc., Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 273 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 273 sq.</bibl>; cf. Munro, ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1183</bibl>: Zumpt, Gr. § 446 sq.; Roby, Gr. § 1199 sq. </sense><sense id="n12301.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ille damnatus est: neque solum primis sententiis, quibus tantum statuebant judices, damnarent an absolverent, sed etiam illis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoris judicium nihil fere damnato nisi ruborem affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 6</bibl></cit> (fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 9</bibl>): ego accusavi, vos damnastis, Dom. Afer ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 79</bibl> et saep. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: causa judicata atque damnata, Cic. Rab. perd. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Clu. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clu. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12301.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">criminis</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poenae</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus damnati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei capitalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris conjurationisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>, et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:83:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 83, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 110, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">octupli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentem capitalis poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 43, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimine falso damnari mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 430</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12301.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is eo crimine damnaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 888" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 888</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiā parte agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo Clodio interfecto eo nomine erat damnatus,</quote> <trans><tr>on that account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; morti (<case>abl.</case>) damnare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 6</bibl>, v. Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n12301.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de majestate damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vi et de majestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vi publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quibus de causis damnati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in metallum damnabuntur, nec in opus publicum, vel ad bestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:18:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ad extremum supplicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 67</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses Socratem damnaverunt quod novam religionem introducere videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">Baebius est damnatus, quod milites praebuisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 31, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnabantur cur jocati essent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 14, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12301.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12301.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oblige one's heir by last will and testament to the performance of any act</hi>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ut, ne</hi>, or the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si damnaverit heredem suum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 4, 16</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem dare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 30, 12</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 86</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12301.8" n="2" level="3"> In a non-legal sense, <hi rend="ital">to condemn, censure, judge</hi>: (with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <case>abl.</case>) aliquem summae stultitiae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 38, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatus longi Sisyphus laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiaeque ibi se damnet (amator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1179</bibl></cit>: damnare aliquem voti (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat., voto, votis), <hi rend="ital">to condemn one to fulfil his vow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by granting his prayer</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">damnabis tu quoque votis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 80</bibl></cit>, Serv. and Heyne: voto, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 277, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voto damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:24" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Fab. 10, 8</bibl> (cf.: voti, Titin. and Turpil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 277, 6</bibl> and 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> Fr. 153</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Turpil. Fr. 128 Ribb.): morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1231</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygio caput damnaverat Orco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnati turis acervi,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted to the gods below</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quem damnet (sc. leto) labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 727</bibl></cit> Heyne: <cit><quote lang="la">damnare eum Senecam et invisum quoque habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to condemn, censure, disapprove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videntur magnopere damnandi, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitori suo creditor saepe damnatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate objects, <hi rend="ital">to condemn, reject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne damnent quae non intelligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:10:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:10:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:11:3:70" default="NO">11, 3, 70</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Part. fut. pass. as subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem non puduisset damnanda committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12301.9" n="II" level="1"> Of the plaintiff, <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">effect a person's condemnation</hi> (rare): quem ad recuperatores modo damnavit Plesidippus, <cb n="DAMN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verrem, quem M. Cicero damnaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16, 9</bibl>; cf. condemno, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II., and condemnator, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.—Hence,damnātus, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n12301.10" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">condemned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicet damnatas ignea testa manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:7:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 7, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12301.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> <hi rend="ital">(effectus pro causa), reprobate, criminal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te miserior? quis te damnatior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnati lingua vocem habet, vim non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:142" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 142</bibl></cit> (Ribb.).—</sense><sense id="n12301.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hateful, wretched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatae noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit> (5, 11 M.), 15.</sense></entryFree>
damnose: <entryFree id="n12302" type="main" key="damno_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. next art. <sense id="n12302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
damnosus: <entryFree id="n12303" type="main" key="damno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>damnum</etym>, <sense id="n12303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of injury;</hi> and hence, </sense><sense id="n12303.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., that causes injury, injurious, hurtful, destructive, pernicious</hi> (very freq. since the Aug. period, not in Cicero or Caesar): <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi commerci est cum dis damnosissimis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 107</bibl></cit>: canes, <hi rend="ital">the worst cast of the tali</hi> (v. canis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:8:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 8, 46</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 65 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et reipublicae et societatibus infidus damnosusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum sumptuosum et damnosum ipsis Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 707</bibl> et saep.— * </sense><sense id="n12303.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., that suffers injury, injured, unfortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12303.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mid., that injures himself, wasteful, prodigal; a spendthrift</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dites mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in alia re damnosior quam in aedificando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">damnōse</orth> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.), in conversational language = immodice: nos nisi damnose bibimus, moriemur inulti, <hi rend="ital">to the injury of the host</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deep, hard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damnum: <entryFree id="n12304" type="main" key="damnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">damnum</orth> (late Lat. sometimes dampnum), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for daminum, neut. of old Part. of dare, = <foreign lang="greek">to\ dido/menon</foreign>, v. Ritschl, Opusc. Phil. 2, 709 sq. Less correctly regarded as akin to <foreign lang="greek">dapa/nh</foreign>. Cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=176" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 176</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 3</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n12304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hurt, harm, damage, injury, loss;</hi> opp. to lucrum (syn. jactura, detrimentum, incommodum, dispendium. Freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12304.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hauscit, hoc paullum lucri quantum ei damni adportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si in maximis lucris paullum aliquid damni contraxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12</bibl> (with dedecus, as in <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 96</bibl> et saep.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 300</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 88</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">propter damna aut detrimenta aliquos miseros esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with detrimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with jactura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: duarum cohortium damno exercitum reducere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4</bibl>; Frontin. Strat. 2, 5, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: damnum dare alicui, <hi rend="ital">to inflict upon one</hi> (ante-classical), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:149" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 149</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 1, 1, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer, sustain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit> (opp. lucrum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 28, 3 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflict a penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:30:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 30, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Fast. 5, 311</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the alliterative passage: in palaestram, ubi damnis desudascitur, Ubi pro disco damnum capiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer harm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl> (but damnum pati, also, <hi rend="ital">to permit, put up with harm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 750</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ferre (a favorite expression of Ovid),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 522</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:34 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 34 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere (of disease),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenit ad miseros damno graviore colonos Pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 552</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 213</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 777: damna tamen celeres reparant caelestia lunae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the waning of the moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae damnum,</quote> <trans><tr>natural defect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum appellandum est cum mala fama lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:135" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 135</bibl></cit> (Ribb.).— </sense><sense id="n12304.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ad damnum (i. e. scortum) deferetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21</bibl> and 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 381</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 133</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12304.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in law. </sense><sense id="n12304.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fine, mulct, penalty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:32" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam tanto damno senatorem coegit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (leges) morte, exsilio, vinclis, damno coercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12304.5" n="B" level="2"> Freq. in the terms, </sense><sense id="n12304.6" n="1" level="3"> damnum injuria (datum), i. e. <hi rend="ital">an injury done to another's beast or</hi> <cb n="DANI" /> <hi rend="ital">slave</hi>, for which the lex Aquilia provided compensation, (Caesulenus senex) cum ab Sabellio multam lege Aquilia damni injuria petivisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12304.7" n="2" level="3"> Damnum infectum, <hi rend="ital">an injury not done but threatened</hi>, and against which the person endangered might require security, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl>;
