<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl> (cf. infectus).</sense></entryFree>
damocles: <entryFree id="n12305" type="main" key="Da_mo_^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāmō^cles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a courtier of Dionysius the younger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 6</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:40" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 40</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
damoetas: <entryFree id="n12306" type="main" key="Da_moetas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāmoetas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*damoi/tas</foreign>, <sense id="n12306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
damon: <entryFree id="n12307" type="main" key="Da_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāmon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <foreign lang="greek">*da/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n12307.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Pythagorean, celebrated on account of the friendship between him and Phintias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12307.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian musician, teacher of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12307.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A goat-herd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
dampno: <entryFree id="n12308" type="main" key="dampno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dampno</orth>, v. damno <sense id="n12308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
damula: <entryFree id="n12309" type="main" key="da_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dāmŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">damm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>damma</etym>, <sense id="n12309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fallow-deer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 13, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dane: <entryFree id="n12310" type="main" key="dane"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dane</orth> = dasne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 22</bibl>; v. do <sense id="n12310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
danae: <entryFree id="n12311" type="main" key="Da^na^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dana/h</foreign>, <sense id="n12311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Acrisius, and mother of Perseus by Zeus</hi>, who visited her in the form of a shower of gold, when she was shut up in a tower by her father, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 16, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 63" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 12</bibl> (3, 13, 12 M.); 2, 32, 59 (3, 30, 59 M.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Met. 4, 610</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:401" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 401</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:410 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 410 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12311.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">*danah/i+os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Danae, descended from Danae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Perseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also volucer Danaeius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:892" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 892</bibl></cit>; Persis (so named after Perses, the <hi rend="ital">son</hi> of Perseus, and ancestor of the Persians), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 225</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
danai: <entryFree id="n12312" type="main" key="Da^na^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăi</orth>, v. Danaus, II. A.</entryFree>
danaster: <entryFree id="n12313" type="main" key="Da^naster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river forming the boundary between Dacia and Sarmatia, now the Dniester</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> Marc. 31, 3, 3</bibl> (class. Tyras).</sense></entryFree>
danaus: <entryFree id="n12314" type="main" key="Da^na^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*danao/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Belus, and twin-brother of Aegyptus</hi>: he was the father of fifty daughters; he emigrated from Egypt into Greece, and there founded Argos; <cit><quote lang="la">was slain by Lynceus, after a reign of fifty years,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 168" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:170" default="NO">170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 497</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Parad. 6, 1, 44</bibl>; cf. under <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.—Danai porticus, at Rome, dedicated by Augustus to the Palatine Apollo (726 A. U. C.), famed for its statues of Danaus and his daughters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31, 4</bibl> (3, 29, 4 M.); Tibul. 1, 3, 79; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12314.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n12314.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<hi rend="ital">belonging to Danaus;</hi> hence, in the poets, meton.), <hi rend="ital">Greek, Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:22:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 22, 34</bibl></cit> (4, 22, 34 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Her. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 59</bibl></cit>. Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n12314.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Danai</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the Greeks</hi> (esp. freq. of the Greeks before Troy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 31</bibl> (4, 7, 31 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danaum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 38</bibl> (3, 22, 18 M.); 3, 9, 40 (4, 8, 40 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12314.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*danai+/(des</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the daughters of Danaus, the Danaides</hi>, who, with the exception of Hypermnestra, murdered their husbands at their father's command, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:255" default="NO">255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 757" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 757</bibl>. The classical poets substitute Danai proles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:79" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31, 4</bibl> (3, 29, 4 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">Danai puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danai genus infame,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12314.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănăĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*danai+/dai</foreign> = Danai (v. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.), <hi rend="ital">the Greeks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 611" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 611</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dandari: <entryFree id="n12315" type="main" key="Danda^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dandări</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tindări</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*danda/rioi</foreign>, <sense id="n12315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian tribe in Asiatic Sarmatia, S. E. of the</hi> Palus Maeotis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl>: also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dandăridae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">their country</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dandă-rica</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dani: <entryFree id="n12316" type="main" key="Da_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Danes, the people of Denmark</hi>, Venant. Carm. 7, 7, 50; <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> de Reb. Getic. p. 83</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12316.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dā-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Denmark</hi>, Aen. Silv. Hist. Fred. III. p. 131.—</sense><sense id="n12316.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Danish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> <pb n="512" /> <cb n="DAPS" /></sense></entryFree>
daniel: <entryFree id="n12317" type="main" key="Da^ni^e_l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dănĭēl</orth>, <itype>ēlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hebrew prophet</hi>, Vulg. Dan. <hi rend="ital">passim</hi>, Ezek. 14, 14.</sense></entryFree>
danista: <entryFree id="n12318" type="greek" key="da^ni_sta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dănīsta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">daneisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a money-lender, usurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenerator (only in Plautus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 53</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dănīstĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">daneistiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">money-lending, usurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dano: <entryFree id="n12319" type="main" key="da^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăno</orth>, v. do, <sense id="n12319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ad init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
danuvius: <entryFree id="n12320" type="main" key="Da_nu^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dānŭvĭus</orth> (the ending <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ubius</orth> <itype>is a corruption of late Latin</itype>, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 126), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*danou/bios</foreign>, <sense id="n12320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Danube</hi> (in the upper part of its course; <cit><quote lang="la">in the lower called Ister, though the poets use both names promiscuously),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25</bibl>; Sall. H. Fragm. ap. Acr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 18</bibl> (3, 9 Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 9, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:192 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 192 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl>; Orell. Inscr. 648 al.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12320.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dānŭvīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Danub-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Danube, Danubian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dapalis: <entryFree id="n12321" type="main" key="da^pa_li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpālĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>daps</etym>, <sense id="n12321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a sacrificial feast</hi> (ante and post-class.): cena, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 5</bibl> (v. 136 Ribbeck); <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, to whom such a cena was offered,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dapatice: <entryFree id="n12322" type="gloss" key="da^pa_ti^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpātĭce</orth> = magnifice, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpātĭ-cus</orth> = magnificus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 4</bibl> and 5 Müll. [daps].</entryFree>
daphitas: <entryFree id="n12323" type="main" key="Daphitas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daphitas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-das</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sophist of Telmessus, killed by falling from his horse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Fat. 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daphne: <entryFree id="n12324" type="greek" key="da_^phne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dā^phne</orth> (Inscr. freq. DAPHINE, v. Ritschl, Opusc. Phil. 2, 483 sq.), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">da/fnh</foreign>, <sense id="n12324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the laurel-tree, bay-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">baccis redimita daphne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12324.1" n="II" level="1"> Proper name <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daphne</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n12324.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of the river-god Peneus;</hi> she was changed into a laurel-tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 203" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 91</bibl>: according to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 513</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecl. 3, 63</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of the river-god Ladon</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n12324.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place in Syria, near Antioch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 49</bibl>; Hieron. in Ezech. 47, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 33</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12324.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daphnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at Daphne</hi>, Apollo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12324.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daphnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., belonging to Daphne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
daphnia: <entryFree id="n12325" type="greek" key="daphni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daphnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daphnis: <entryFree id="n12326" type="main" key="Daphnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daphnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/fnis</foreign>. <sense id="n12326.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Mercury, a beautiful young shepherd in Sicily, the inventor of pastoral songs, and hence a favorite of Pan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 277</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> usu. Daphnim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 7</bibl> et saep: <cit><quote lang="la">Daphnin,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:68" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 68</bibl> (3, 32, 68 M.).—</sense><sense id="n12326.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grammarian</hi>, sportively called, in allusion to the preceding, <foreign lang="greek">*pano\s a)ga/phma</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daphnoides: <entryFree id="n12327" type="greek" key="da_phno^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dāphnŏīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dafnoeidh/s</foreign> (laurel-like). <sense id="n12327.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of</hi> cassia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 43, § 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12327.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Spurge-laurel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mezereon</hi>, Daphne Mezereum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12327.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant called also</hi> Clematis Aegyptia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 90, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daphnon: <entryFree id="n12328" type="greek" key="daphno_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daphnōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dafnw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n12328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laurel-grove</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:79:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 79, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:51:1" default="NO">12, 51, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dapifer: <entryFree id="n12329" type="main" key="da^pi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>daps-fero</etym>, <sense id="n12329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant who waited at table</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 915, 3</bibl>: cf. dapifer, <foreign lang="greek">sitofo/ros</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
dapifex: <entryFree id="n12330" type="main" key="da^pi^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpĭfex</orth>, <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>daps-facio</etym>, <sense id="n12330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant who prepared food</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1322, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dapino: <entryFree id="n12331" type="hapax" key="da^pi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>daps, cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dei=pnon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n12331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to serve up</hi>, as food: <cit><quote lang="la">victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
daps: <entryFree id="n12332" type="main" key="daps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daps</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dăpis</orth>, <itype>dăpis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> daps obsol. <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. p. 68, 3</bibl>: dapis, Juvenc. ap. Auct. de gen. nom. p. 78.—The <sense id="n12332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. pl.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> do not occur, but are supplied by epulae, cena, convivium, q. v.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stem, dap-, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dapa/nh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">expense</hi>: cf. <foreign lang="greek">dei=pnon</foreign>; R. da-, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dai/w</foreign>, to distribute; Sanscr. dapajami, to cause to divide</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a solemn feast for religious purposes, a sacrificial feast</hi> (before beginning to till the ground; the Greek <foreign lang="greek">prohro/sia</foreign>, made in honor of some divinity, in memory of departed <cb n="DARD" /> friends, etc. Thus distinguished from epulae, <hi rend="ital">a meal</hi> of any kind: convivium, <hi rend="ital">a meal or feast for company;</hi> epulum, <hi rend="ital">a formal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">public dinner</hi>, v. h. v.). </sense><sense id="n12332.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">dapem pro bubus piro florente facito... postea dape facta serito milium, panicum, alium, lentim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:131" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 131</bibl></cit> and 132; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro grege,</quote> <trans><tr>an offering for the protection of the flock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ad fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo obligatam redde Jovi dapem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc Saliaribus Ornare pulvinar deorum Tempus erat dapibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnis dapes et tristia dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 301</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12332.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> by the poets and post-Augustan prose-writers beyond the sphere of religion, and used of every (esp. rich, sumptuous) meal, <hi rend="ital">a feast, banquet</hi>, in the sing. and plur. (in Verg. passim, in Tibul. in this signif. only plur.).—</sense><sense id="n12332.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: ne cum tyranno quisquam... eandem vescatur dapem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 415, 25</bibl> (v. 217 Ribbeck): quae haec daps est? qui festus dies? Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 752</bibl> P. (transl. of Hom. Od. 1, 225: <foreign lang="greek">ti/s dai+/s, ti/s de\ o(/milos o(/d) e)/pleto</foreign>); so Catull. 64, 305; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 51</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">of a simple, poor meal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 206</bibl>. Opp. to wine: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc dape, nunc posito mensae nituere Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:521" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 521</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so in plur.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 571</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 706</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12332.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:8" default="NO">1, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 210</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 32, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 664</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">humanae,</quote> <trans><tr>human excrement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dapsile: <entryFree id="n12333" type="main" key="dapsi^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dapsĭle</orth>, <sense id="n12333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., sumptuously, bountifully</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art., <hi rend="ital">Adv., no.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dapsilis: <entryFree id="n12334" type="main" key="dapsi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dapsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n12334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> dapsilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 3</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">dayilh/s</foreign>, daps</etym>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous, bountiful, richly provided with every thing, abundant</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">in the class. period perhaps only in Colum. and Suet.): sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">lubentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proventus (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia facundiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12334.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">spionia dapsilis musto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv., sumptuously, bountifully</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12334.2" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dapsĭlĭter</orth>: d. suos amicos alit, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 178</bibl> P. (v. 39 Ribbeck).—</sense><sense id="n12334.3" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dapsĭle</orth>: verrem sume dapsile ac dilucide, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 27</bibl> (v. 161 Ribbeck): convivebatur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12334.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> invitavit se dapsilius, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 321, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dardanarius: <entryFree id="n12335" type="main" key="darda^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dardănārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speculator in corn, forestaller</hi> (law Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:37" default="NO">48, 19, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dardani: <entryFree id="n12336" type="main" key="Darda^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardăni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/rdanoi</foreign>, <sense id="n12336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Upper Moesia, the modern Servia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 20</bibl>; Eutrop. 5, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:3 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 6, 3 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">their country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dardanus: <entryFree id="n12337" type="main" key="Darda^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/rdanos</foreign>. <sense id="n12337.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Jupiter and Electra of Arcadia, founder of the city Dardania, in Troas, and ancestor of the royal race of Troy</hi>, Att. ap. Schol. Bern. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 502</bibl> (v. 653 Ribb.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 134</bibl> Serv.; 6, 650; 3, 167 al.; cf. Heyne <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3</bibl> Excurs. 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 23, 3</bibl>: <case>acc.</case> Dardanon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 31</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12337.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12337.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dardanian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Aeneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit> (5, 1, 40 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; also for <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>, as the Romans were descendants of Aeneas: <cit><quote lang="la">ductor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Roman, Scipio Africanus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12337.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dardanian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes, Att. ap. Apul. de Deo Soc. 24 (v. 523 Ribbeck): gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 494</bibl></cit>; 6, 169; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Aeneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 658</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and pinus, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:519" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anchisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 617</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iulus (son of Aeneas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:431" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helenus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:335" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Priam</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit> (3, 6, 1 M): <cit><quote lang="la">minister,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ganymedes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104</bibl></cit>, et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12337.4" n="b" level="4"> Subst.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, </sense><sense id="n12337.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">the city Dardania, founded by Dardanus<cb n="DATI" />  on the Hellespont, S. W. of Abydos</hi> (whence its mod. name, <hi rend="ital">the Dardanelles</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 25</bibl>. Oftener, esp. in Vergil, </sense><sense id="n12337.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Troja</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 281</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">325</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12337.7" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son</hi> or <hi rend="ital">descendant of Dardanus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:419" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 419</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> for <hi rend="ital">Aeneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 545</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 775</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> for <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> for <hi rend="ital">Trojans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 72</bibl>; 445 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12337.8" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dardanian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caieta (founded by Trojans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> for <hi rend="ital">Creüsa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 787</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12337.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A magician of Phoenicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 331, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12337.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Dardanus</hi>: <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Magic</hi>, artes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:358" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 358</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12337.11" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic philosopher otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12338" type="main" key="Darda^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dardănus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; v. the preceding art. <sense id="n12338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 1.</sense></entryFree>
dares: <entryFree id="n12339" type="main" key="Da^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dăres</orth>, <itype>ētis and is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/rhs</foreign>. <sense id="n12339.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A boxer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 369</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">375</bibl>: <case>acc.</case> Dareta, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 460</bibl>; 463 al; <cit><quote lang="la">Daren,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 456</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12339.1" n="II" level="1"> Phrygius, <hi rend="ital">the assumed name of an impostor whose pretended contemporary account of the Trojan war was received as an authority in the 7th century A. D.</hi> Cf. Teuffel, Roem. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 464; F. Meister, über Dares von Phr., Breslau, 1871.</sense></entryFree>
dareus: <entryFree id="n12340" type="main" key="Da_re_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dārēus</orth> (so the best editt. of Cicero and Curtius; cf. Zumpt, Gramm. § 2) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dā-rīus</orth> (Dărĭī, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 51</bibl>: <sense id="n12340.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Dărīos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 23</bibl></cit>, v. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*da/reios</foreign> [a Persian word, from R. dar-, to hold: <cit><quote lang="la">"the sustainer of the empire," Max. Müller, Science of Lang. 2, 220],</quote> <trans><tr>the name of several Persian Kings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 41</bibl>; Curt. and Just. passim; Ov. lb. 317; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epist. 1, 17</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12340.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the gold coin stamped under Darius, a daric</hi>, Aus. l. l.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Darīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">of Darius</hi>, opes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 578</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dasea: <entryFree id="n12341" type="main" key="da^se_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăsēa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dasīa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dasei=a</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">prosw|di/a</foreign>, <sense id="n12341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rough-breathing</hi> or spiritus asper, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Com. Art. Don. p. 80" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Com. Art. Don. p. 80</bibl> Lind.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1287</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
dassaresii: <entryFree id="n12342" type="main" key="Dassaresii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dassaresii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dassaren-ses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dassarētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dasypus: <entryFree id="n12343" type="greek" key="da^sy^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăsypūs</orth>, <itype>ŏdis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dasu/pous</foreign> (rough-foot), <sense id="n12343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of rabbit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:179 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 63, 83, § 179 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
datarius: <entryFree id="n12344" type="hapax" key="da^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dătārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>do</etym>, <sense id="n12344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be given away</hi> (a comic word): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est mihi salus dataria,</quote> <trans><tr>I have no salutation to give away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
datatim: <entryFree id="n12345" type="main" key="da^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dătātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> [dato), <sense id="n12345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">giving in turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reciprocally</hi>, "invicem dando," <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 15</bibl> (ante-class. and rare): isti qui ludunt datatim, i. e. (in playing ball) <hi rend="ital">by tossing from one to the other</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 17</bibl>. Obscenè, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 25, 2</bibl>; Afran. and Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 19</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:v. 222" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> v. 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:v. 1" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> v. 1</bibl> ribbeck); cf. Nov. ap. Non. ib. (v. 23 Ribbeck).</sense></entryFree>
dathiatum: <entryFree id="n12346" type="main" key="dathi^a_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dathĭātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reddish sort of incense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
datio: <entryFree id="n12347" type="main" key="da^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>do</etym>, <sense id="n12347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the act of giving, allotting, distributing; giving up, surrender</hi> (good prose, but rare).—</sense><sense id="n12347.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">in datione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: legum ( = latio), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signi dationem Palamedes invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati, opp. ademptio legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12347.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12347.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The right to give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convey away</hi> property: <hi rend="ital">right of alienation</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12347.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gift</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">datio Dei permanet pistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach. 11, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
datis: <entryFree id="n12348" type="main" key="Da_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dātis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*da=tis</foreign>), <sense id="n12348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general of the Medes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dativus: <entryFree id="n12349" type="main" key="da^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dătīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>do</etym>, <sense id="n12349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to giving, given, appointed</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n12349.1" n="I" level="1"> In jurid. Lat.: dativi tutores "<hi rend="ital">qui nominatim testamento dantur</hi>," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:section=149" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, § 149</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12349.2" n="II" level="1"> In gram.: dativus casus, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">da-tivus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dative</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO">7, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl> et saep. (cf. casus dandi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:18:112" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 18, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10:2:165" default="NO">10, 2, 165</bibl>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:4 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 4 al.</bibl>). <pb n="513" /> <cb n="DE" /></sense></entryFree>
dato: <entryFree id="n12350" type="main" key="da^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dăto</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <sense id="n12350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. frequent</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12350.1" n="I" level="1"> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to give away, administer</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug., and very rare): evectionem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Antomn. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Antomn. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum fenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum annuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binas non amplius drachmas (hellebori),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 23, § 58</bibl></cit>. Obscenè, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 10</bibl>; cf. datatim.</sense></entryFree>
dator: <entryFree id="n12351" type="main" key="da^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giver</hi> (except in Plant. rare). </sense><sense id="n12351.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 18</bibl>; fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 616</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">assit laetitiae Bacchus dator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarem enim datorem diligit Deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12351.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in playing ball, <hi rend="ital">the slave who hands the ball to the player</hi>, opp. factor, the player himself, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
datus: <entryFree id="n12352" type="main" key="da^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dătus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving</hi>: in <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12352.1" n="II" level="1"> = datum, <hi rend="ital">a gift</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">datus insipientis non est utilis tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 20, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
daucius: <entryFree id="n12353" type="main" key="Dauci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daucĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of Daucus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans><tr>twins whom their parents could not distinguish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 391</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
daucum: <entryFree id="n12354" type="greek" key="daucum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">daucum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">daucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 167" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:170" default="NO">170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:177" default="NO">177</bibl> = <foreign lang="greek">dau=kon</foreign>, <sense id="n12354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of the parsnip or carrot kind</hi>, much used in medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissimus in Creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:110 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 64, § 110 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23, 3 al.</bibl> In <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 80</bibl>, called daucion and daucites.</sense></entryFree>
daulis: <entryFree id="n12355" type="main" key="Daulis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daulis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dauli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Phocis</hi>, situated on an eminence, and celebrated as the scene of the fable of Tereus, Progne, and Philomela, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Theb. 7, 344</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12355.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district in Phocis, on the frontier of Doris</hi>, = Drymaea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12355.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daulĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Daulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Progne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 154</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol., Daulias</hi>, Catull. 65, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">Dauliades puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Progne and Philomela</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12355.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daulis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Daulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens sororque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 275" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daulida rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 276</bibl></cit> (where Daulia is a false reading).</sense></entryFree>
daunus: <entryFree id="n12356" type="main" key="Daunus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Daunus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dau=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n12356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous king over a part of Apulia</hi> (whence it obtained the appellation <hi rend="ital">Daunia</hi>), <hi rend="ital">father</hi> (or ancestor) <hi rend="ital">of Turnus, and father-in-law of Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 616</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">688</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 22 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 30, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">510</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=69:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 69, 1</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n12356.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12356.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dau-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Daunian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Turnus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Rutulians governed by Turnus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juturna, sister of Turnus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Romans (pars pro toto)</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Camena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Roman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bulbus (an excellent kind growing in Apulia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 797</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12356.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daunii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Apulia Daunia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Dauni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12356.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Daunĭăcus</orth> <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Daunian</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Apulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:429" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12356.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dau-nĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the province Daunia</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Apulia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 22, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dautia: <entryFree id="n12357" type="gloss" key="dautia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dautia</orth> = lautia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 10</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
david: <entryFree id="n12358" type="main" key="Da_vi_d"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāvīd</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, or vīdis (<sense id="n12358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> David, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Davidis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 151</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> -vīda, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 577</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">David,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 16</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">the second king of the Jews, and principal author of the Book of Psalms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9</bibl> et 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth 4, 17</bibl> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāvīdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to David</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
davus: <entryFree id="n12359" type="main" key="Da_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dāvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Davos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given to Roman slaves</hi>, freq. in the comedies of Plaut. and Ter.; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:161" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:168 al" default="NO">168 al.</bibl> —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Davus sum, non Oedipus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
de: <entryFree id="n12360" type="main" key="de_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>: of place, <sense id="n12360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">down</hi>, only in the phrase susque deque, q. v.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12361" type="main" key="de_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>perh. for <hi rend="ital">ded;</hi> cf. Oscan dat, old <case>abl.</case> of pronom. stem da; cf. also Lith. praep. da, <hi rend="ital">as far as;</hi> and the suffixes, old case-forms, -dam, -dem, -dum, -do, with the locative -de; v. Ribbeck, Beitr. z. L. v. d. Lat. Part. p. 4 sq.</etym> (with <case>abl.</case>, denotes<cb n="DE" />  <sense id="n12361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the going out, departure, removal</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">separating</hi> of an object from any fixed point. Accordingly, it occupies a middle place between <hi rend="ital">ab, away from</hi>, which denotes <hi rend="ital">a mere external departure</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">ex, out of</hi>, which signifies <hi rend="ital">from the interior</hi> of a thing. Hence verbs compounded with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> are constr. not only with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, but quite as freq. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ex;</hi> and, on the other hand, those compounded with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> often have the terminus a quo indicated by <hi rend="ital">de</hi>), <hi rend="ital">from, away from, down from, out of</hi>, etc.</sense><sense id="n12361.1" n="A" level="2"> In space, lit. and trop. with verbs of motion: animam de corpore mitto, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 150, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 216 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo quom jam sucus de corpore cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quod Ariovistus) de altera parte agri Sequanos decedere juberet,</quote> <trans><tr>to depart, withdraw from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitati persuasit, ut de finibus suis cum omnibus copiis exirent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedere de provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 49</bibl></cit> ( = ex provincia, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 65</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">147): de vita decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire de vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excedere e vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">de triclinio, de cubiculo exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamum de cubiculo ut e navicula jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de castris procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica de capite et de oculis omnia (mala) deducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:6" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de digito anulum detraho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de matris complexu aliquem avellere atque abstrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum de tabula sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum de manibus extorsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris utilitas vel a peritis vel de libris depromi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">... decido de lecto praeceps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de muro se deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sella exsilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ex equo vel de muro, etc., hostem destinare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9, p. 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo aliquid demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1155</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:14:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 14, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12361.2" n="b" level="4"> In gen., to indicate the person or place from which any thing is taken, etc., with verbs of taking away, depriving, demanding, requesting, inquiring, buying; as capere, sumere, emere, quaerere, discere, trahere, etc., and their compounds; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emere de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mercari de aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo quaerere, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe hoc audivi de patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 133</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de mausoleo exaudita vox est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sibi liceret discere id de me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with petere, of place (class.): de vicino terra petita solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:822" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 822</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of persons (late Lat.): peto de te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:57:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 57, § 2</bibl></cit>; Apul. M. 6, p. 179, 40.</sense><sense id="n12361.3" n="2" level="3"> To point out the place from which any thing is brought; and hence, trop., to indicate its origin, derivation, etc.: <hi rend="ital">of, from</hi>: de circo astrologi, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caupo de via Latina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio qui de circo maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamator aliqui de ludo aut rabula de foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo de schola atque a magistro ... eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautae de navi Alexandrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis de ponte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a beggar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyca de rupe leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:209" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro de rure corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vaticano fragiles de monte patellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:344 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 344 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summo loco Summoque genere eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genetrix Priami de gente vetusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 284</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 350</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:126" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Numitore sati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Philocteta, id,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 35, 141</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e Philocteta versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>).</sense><sense id="n12361.4" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, to indicate the quarter from which motion proceeds (cf. ab), <hi rend="ital">from</hi>, and because motion is so often and naturally downwards, <hi rend="ital">down from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec agebantur in conventu, palam, de sella ac de loco superiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad se vocari et de tribunali citari jussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nihil ex occulto, nihil de insidiis, agendum putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">de tergo plagas dare,</quote> <trans><tr>from behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paupere mensa dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit> et saep.—In jurid. Latin: de plano discutere, interloqui, cognoscere, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">on level ground</hi>, not on the tribunal (cf. <foreign lang="greek">xamo/qen</foreign>, opp. <foreign lang="greek">pro\ bh/matos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:13:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 13, § 10</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO">1, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>. 3, 11 et saep.; so, <cb n="DE" /> de plano, <hi rend="ital">off-hand, without formal consideration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 411</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. planus.—And with pendeo, etc. (the motion in the eye transferred to the object): deque viri collo dulce pependit onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:760" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna de camera pendebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et nova de gravido palmite gemma tumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:152" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de qua pariens arbore nixa dea est,</quote> <trans><tr>leaning downwards against the tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12361.5" n="B" level="2"> In time. </sense><sense id="n12361.6" n="1" level="3"> Immediately following a given moment of time, <hi rend="ital">after, directly after</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">de concursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 384</bibl></cit> (cf. Munro, ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">velim scire hodiene statim de auctione aut quo die venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non bonus somnus est de prandio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eorum verbis prosilui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 178</bibl></cit>.—Hence, diem de die, <hi rend="ital">from day to day, day after day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is diem de die differret, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diem de die proferendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: de die in diem, <hi rend="ital">from day to day, daily</hi> (eccl.
