Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:60:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 60, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl> Pet. 2, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 3, 11</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12361.7" n="2" level="3"> De nocte, de vigilia, etc., to designate an act which begins or takes its origin from the night-time, Engl. <hi rend="ital">during</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the course of the night, at night, by night</hi>, etc.: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Rus cras cum filio Cum primo lucu ibo hinc. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Imo de nocte censeo, <hi rend="ital">to-night rather</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 55</bibl>: in comitium Milo de nocte venit, <hi rend="ital">in the night</hi> (cf. shortly before, Milo media nocte in campum venit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 33, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilas tu de nocte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de nocte evigilabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jugulent homines, surgunt de nocte latrones,</quote> <trans><tr>at night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Hannibal surgere de nocte solitus, Frontin Strat. 4, 3, 7 et saep.: ut de nocte multa impigreque exsurrexi,</quote> <trans><tr>late in the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">multa de nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (for which multa nocte, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9</bibl>); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: si de multa nocte (al. de nocte) vigilassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar mittit complures equitum turmas eo de media nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 88</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">media de nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>at midnight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar de tertia vigilia e castris profectus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the third night-watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tertia vigilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44</bibl> Drak.; 40, 4 al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de quarta vigilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21, 3 al.</bibl></cit>; v. vigilia. —As in this manner <hi rend="ital">de nocte</hi> became adverbially = <hi rend="ital">nocte, so de die</hi> was sometimes used for <hi rend="ital">die</hi> or <hi rend="ital">per diem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de die potare,</quote> <trans><tr>by day, in the daytime</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulari de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 8</bibl>; Catull. 47, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Domit. 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bibulus media de luce Falerni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a lusus verbb. with in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Less freq., de mense: <cit><quote lang="la">navigare de mense Decembri,</quote> <trans><tr>in December</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—And once de tempore for tempore: ipse de tempore coenavit, Auct. B. Hisp. 33, 5.</sense><sense id="n12361.8" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, implying separation, departure from, etc.</sense><sense id="n12361.9" n="1" level="3"> To designate the whole, from which a part is taken, or of which a part is separately regarded, etc., <hi rend="ital">from among, out of, from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem certum misi de comitibus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio percussus ab uno de illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis de nostris hominibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemvis de iis qui essent idonei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tribus et decem fundis tres nobilissimi fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 99</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">accusator de plebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsare minimum de plebe Quiritem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus poëta de populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem solido demere de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum de vita perdiderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteriine tuas de tot caelestibus aras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Her. 21, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 138</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12361.10" n="b" level="4"> Sometimes <hi rend="ital">de</hi> with <case>abl.</case> takes the place of the <hi rend="ital">gen. partit.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi> In the best writers this occurs mainly </sense><sense id="n12361.11" n="(a)" level="5"> to avoid ambiguity where genitives would be multiplied: <cit><quote lang="la">ne expers partis esset de nostris bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquem partem de istius impudentia reticere possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 32</bibl></cit>; </sense><sense id="n12361.12" n="(b)" level="5"> for greater precision: <cit><quote lang="la">si quae sunt de eodem genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persona de mimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>; </sense><sense id="n12361.13" n="(g)" level="5"> in the poets, metri gratiā: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de more vetusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:309" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 309</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes de Caesare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera de genere hoc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Sat. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 746</bibl>. This circumlocution was freq. <pb n="514" /> <cb n="DE" /> in comic writers and in vulgar lang., and became more common in the declining periods of the lang., so that in the Romance tongues <hi rend="ital">de, di</hi>, etc., with a case represent the earlier genitive (so, conscius, conscientia, meminisse, mentionem facere, recordari, etc., de aliqua re for alicujus rei, v. h. vv.).</sense><sense id="n12361.14" n="2" level="3"> To indicate the property from which the costs of any thing are taken: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonat, potat, olet unguenta de meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de tuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de vestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:828" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 60</bibl>. For de tuo, once de te: <cit><quote lang="la">de te largitor puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—Also in a trop. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tua praecepta de meo nihil his novum apposivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1</bibl>. 2, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, to denote that out of which, or by which, one pays a penalty or suffers punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">has vestro de sanguine poenas datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 805</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de visceribus tuis satisfacturus sis quibus debes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Frat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12361.15" n="3" level="3"> To designate the material of which any thing is made, <hi rend="ital">of, out of, from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveo factum de marmore signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 313</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verno de flore corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus de quinquefolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis de fico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">de templo carcerem fleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:32" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivum de rege facturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inque deum de bove versus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:616" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 616</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fles de rhetore consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 197</bibl></cit>.—Cf. trop. <hi rend="ital">by means of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eodem oleo et opera exaravi nescio quid ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 38</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">de nihilo nihilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:84" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:157 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 157 sq.</bibl></sense><sense id="n12361.16" n="4" level="3"> In mental operations, to indicate the subject-matter or theme on which any mental act (thinking, considering, advising, determining, etc.; discoursing, informing, exhorting, deciding, disputing, doubting, etc.) is founded; <hi rend="ital">of, about, concerning</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">peri/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare de aliqua re, etc. (the most common signification): multa narrare de Laelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitare de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de suo adventu docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de moribus admonere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Cat. 5, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—With this, too, is connected its use,</sense><sense id="n12361.17" n="5" level="3"> To indicate the producing cause or reason, <hi rend="ital">for, on account of, because of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam id nisi gravi de causa non fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 186</bibl>; Cael ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo nomine ad arbitrum adiisti, de eo ad judicium venisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebat uterque non de suo supplicio, sed pater de filii morte, de patris filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de labore pectus tundit,</quote> <trans><tr>with pain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 2, 6, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessit passu de vulnere tardo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus fervet de corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:560" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius de odio creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat de me feliciter Ilia mater,</quote> <trans><tr>through me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:233" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 233</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n12361.18" n="6" level="3"> To indicate the thing with reference to which any thing is done, <hi rend="ital">with respect to, concerning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de istac re in oculum utrumvis conquiescito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: nil peccat de savio, Caec. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 11</bibl> (v. 161 Ribbeck): <cit><quote lang="la">credere de numero militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de numero dierum fidem servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ceteris senatui curae fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Jug. 26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jug. 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessum ab nobilitate de consule plebeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem de virgine rapta consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:581" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 581</bibl></cit> et saep.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">de argento somnium,</quote> <trans><tr>as for the money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 4</bibl>: quod de argento sperem, nihil est): <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Dionysio sum admiratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de me autem suscipe paullisper meas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 36</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">de Samnitibus triumphare,</quote> <trans><tr>concerning, over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> 4, 2, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Atheniensibus victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12361.19" n="7" level="3"> To indicate the thing in conformity with which any thing is done, <hi rend="ital">according to, after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum: DE SENATVOS SENTENTIAD, S. C. de Bac.: fecisse dicas de mea sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 4, 9, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de suorum propinquorum sententia atque auctoritate fecisse dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29</bibl></cit>: de consilii sententia Mamertinis se frumentum non <cb n="DEAC" /> imperare pronunciat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ejus consilio velle sese facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix de mea voluntate concessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exemplo meo ipse aedificato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de more vetusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 606</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:447" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrioque vocat de nomine mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12361.20" n="8" level="3"> With adjectives to form adverbial expressions. </sense><sense id="n12361.21" n="a" level="4"> De integro, <hi rend="ital">anew</hi> ( = ab integro, ex integro; cf.: iterum, rursus, denuo), indidemque eadem aeque oriuntur de integro, atque eodem occidunt, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 17</bibl> Müll. (v. 92 Ribb.): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio de integro ineunda est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 2</bibl> et saep. (The combination de novo appears only in the contracted form denuo, v. h. v.).—</sense><sense id="n12361.22" n="b" level="4"> De improviso, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi de improviso interventum est mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 39</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12361.23" n="c" level="4"> De transverso, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem de transverso L. Caesar ut veniam ad se rogat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl>.!*? De is often put between an adj. or pron. and its substantive; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">above multa de nocte, media de nocte, gravi de causa, etc.: qua de re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; esp. in the judic. formula: qua de re agitur; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Also freq. after a simple relative: <cit><quote lang="la">quo de,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">54, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua de,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 70</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n12361.24" n="II" level="1"> In composition the <hi rend="ital">e</hi> becomes short before a vowel, as in dĕhisco, dĕhinc, dĕorsum, and coincides with it in the poets by synaeresis; cf.: dehinc, deinde, deinceps, deorsum; sometimes contraction takes place, as in debeo, debilis, dego, demo, from dehabeo, de-habilis, de-ago, de-emo.—</sense><sense id="n12361.25" n="2" level="3"> Signif. </sense><sense id="n12361.26" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Separation, departure, removal, taking away; off, away, down, out</hi>: decedo, demigro, demeto, depromo, descendo, devolvo, derivo, deflecto, etc.; and trop. dedico, denuntio; and in a downward direction, decido, decumbo, deprimo, demergo, delabor, defluo, demitto, desido, desideo, declivis, deculco, degredior, deicio, etc.—</sense><sense id="n12361.27" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Cessation, removal</hi> of the fundamental idea ( = un-, de-, dis-): dearmo, deartuo, decresco, dedisco, dedecoro, dedignor, dedoceo, denascor, denormo, desum, etc.; and hence direct <hi rend="ital">negation</hi>, as in dedecet, deformis, demens, etc.—</sense><sense id="n12361.28" n="c" level="4"> With reference to the terminus of the action: defero, defigo, demitto, etc.; hence also trop., <hi rend="ital">with reference to the extent</hi> of the action, <hi rend="ital">to the uttermost, to exhaustion, through. out</hi>: debacchor, debello, dedolo, delino, delibuo, etc.: defatigo, delaboro, delasso, etc.; hence freq. a mere <hi rend="ital">strengthening of the fundamental idea</hi>, = valde, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly, much</hi>: demiror, demitigo, etc.—</sense><sense id="n12361.29" n="d" level="4"> Giving a bad sense to the verb: decipio, delinquo, deludo, derideo, detestor.—</sense><sense id="n12361.30" n="e" level="4"> Rarely, <hi rend="ital">contraction from a broad into a narrow space, together</hi>: deligo, devincio. See also Hand Turs. II. p. 183-229.</sense></entryFree>
dea: <entryFree id="n12362" type="main" key="de^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n12362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; Ins. Orell. 2076: deabus, Cn. Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 39</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:C. D. 7:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> C. D. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:3:3" default="NO">3, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Apul. M. 4, p. 156: dis deabusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; id. fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> P., IV. 2, p. 451 ed. Orell.; cf. DIVIS DIVABVSQVE, Inscr. ap. Voss. Arist. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>: Juno sancta dearum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 576</bibl> (Annal. v. 65 Vahl.): his diis (i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>) Helicona atque Olympon attribuerunt homines, Varr. l. l.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">for the same, novem deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 348</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Thespiades deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 310</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and only deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 641</bibl></cit>: dea, magna dea, Cybebe, dea domina Dindymi, Catull. 63, 91: mille dea est operum: certe dea carminis illa est (sc. <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:833" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 833</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellica,</quote> <trans><tr>the same</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatrix,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:454" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the same</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:654" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 2, 654</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">triplices poenarum Eumenides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:481" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 18</bibl></cit> (4, 20, 8 M.) et saep. For the combination di deaeque, v. deus; Bona Dea, v. bonus, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> F. —The appellation DEA is freq. on the tombs of women, Inscr. ap. Fea, p. 173; Fabretti, Inscr. p. 266, 106 al.</sense></entryFree>
deacinatus: <entryFree id="n12363" type="hapax" key="de^a^ci^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ăcĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acinus</etym>, <cb n="DEAU" /> <sense id="n12363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleared from the grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:26" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 26</bibl></cit> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
deactio: <entryFree id="n12364" type="gloss" key="de^acti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕactĭo</orth> = peractio, <sense id="n12364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finishing</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 11</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dealbatio: <entryFree id="n12365" type="main" key="de^alba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕalbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dealbo</etym>, <sense id="n12365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whitewashing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 3:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dealbator: <entryFree id="n12366" type="hapax" key="de^alba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕalbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dealbo</etym>, <sense id="n12366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who whitens over, a whitewasher, a pargeter, plasterer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dealbo: <entryFree id="n12367" type="main" key="de^albo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-albo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>albus</etym>, <sense id="n12367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whiten over, to whitewash, to parget, plaster</hi> (good prose, but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (twice): <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gall. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl>.—Prov.: duo parietes de eadem fidelia, Curius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29</bibl>; v. fidelia.—In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to purify, cleanse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sanguine Agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass., to be white</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 50, 8 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕalbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., whitewashed, plastered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulchra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Conf. 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deambulacrum: <entryFree id="n12368" type="main" key="de^ambu^la_crum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕambŭlācrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>deambulo</etym>, <sense id="n12368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place to walk in, a promenade, walk</hi>, Mamert. Grat. act. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Julian.</author> 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deambulatio: <entryFree id="n12369" type="main" key="de^ambu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕambŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> [id.), <sense id="n12369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a walking abroad, promenading</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:141" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deambulatorium: <entryFree id="n12370" type="hapax" key="de^ambu^la_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕambŭlātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gallery for walking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 3, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deambulo: <entryFree id="n12371" type="main" key="de^ambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to walk abroad, walk much, to take a walk, to promenade</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aegrotus saliat decies et deambulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:127" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 127 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">156, 4</bibl>: eamus deambulatum, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 256</bibl>; so in the <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">deambulanti in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 13, 7</bibl> (ambulatum is the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 14</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
deamo: <entryFree id="n12372" type="main" key="de^a^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ămo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to be desperately in love with, to love dearly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passionately</hi> (ante-class.), "vehementius amare," <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 21</bibl> (cf. <hi rend="ital">depereo</hi>). </sense><sense id="n12372.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quam tuus gnatus annos multos deamat, deperit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 72</bibl>; Afran. ap. Non. l. l. (v. 357 Ribbeck): Laber. ap. Charis. l, p. 84 P. (v. 41 Ribbeck).—</sense><sense id="n12372.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12372.3" n="A" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to be quite in love with, delighted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deamavi ... lepidissima munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dona deamata acceptaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: deamo te, Syre, <hi rend="ital">I am greatly obliged to you</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deana: <entryFree id="n12373" type="gloss" key="De^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Diana.</entryFree>
deargento: <entryFree id="n12374" type="main" key="de^argento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-argento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>argentum</etym>. * <sense id="n12374.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive of money</hi> (anteclass.): depeculassere aliqua sperans me atque deargentassere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12374.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To silver over, to plate with silver</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">idola deargentata et deaurata, Hier. in les. 9, 30, 24: arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 23:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deargumentor: <entryFree id="n12375" type="main" key="de^argu_mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-argūmentor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n12375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to decide finally</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">super aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. de Statu An. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dearmo: <entryFree id="n12376" type="main" key="de^armo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-armo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n12376.0" n="I" level="1"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to disarm</hi> (except in particip., late Lat. for armis spoliare): <cit><quote lang="la">dearmatus exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4</bibl></cit>. 10, 7.—</sense><sense id="n12376.1" n="II" level="1"> Aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of power, blunt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram expilet, sagittas dearmet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deartuo: <entryFree id="n12377" type="main" key="de^artu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-artŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>artus; cf. artuatus and artuatim</etym>. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n12377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dismember, to rend limb by limb;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to ruin</hi>: "quasi per artus concidere," <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 17</bibl> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">fallaciis opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deartuatus sum hujus technis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. Non. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
deascio: <entryFree id="n12378" type="main" key="de^asci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ascĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1, ascio</etym>, <sense id="n12378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut with an axe, to smoothe</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12378.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (late Lat.): deasciato stipiti, <hi rend="ital">wrought, smoothed</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 381.— </sense><sense id="n12378.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rub out, efface</hi>: hunc titulum, Murat. Inscr. 1203, 9.—</sense><sense id="n12378.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to cheat, to chouse</hi> (cf. abrado), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deaurator: <entryFree id="n12379" type="main" key="de^aura_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕaurātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deauro</etym>, <sense id="n12379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gilder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deauro: <entryFree id="n12380" type="main" key="de^auro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-auro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to gild, to gild over</hi> (late Lat. for inaurare): cassidas et tegerent argento et deanrarent, Cod. <pb n="515" /> <cb n="DEBE" /> Theod. 10, 22, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:36:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 36, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 44, 9</bibl></cit>: SIGNVM DEAVRATVM, Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3173 (of the year 162 post-Chr.).</sense></entryFree>
debacchatio: <entryFree id="n12381" type="main" key="de_baccha_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbacchātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>debacchor</etym>, <sense id="n12381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">passionate raving, fury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
debacchor: <entryFree id="n12382" type="main" key="de_bacchor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-bacchor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to rave like the Bacchantes, to rage without control, revel wildly</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si satis jam debacchatus es, leno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 30 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ies. 11, 37, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12382.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi>: qua parte debacchentur ignes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 3, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
debatuo: <entryFree id="n12383" type="hapax" key="de_ba_tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-bātŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to beat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust severely</hi> (obsc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
debellator: <entryFree id="n12384" type="main" key="de_bella_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbellātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>debello</etym>, <sense id="n12384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conqueror, subduer</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): ferarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 651</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:545" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 545</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vespasianus Judaeorum debellator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debellatrix: <entryFree id="n12385" type="main" key="de_bella_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbellātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>debellator</etym>, <sense id="n12385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conqueress, she that conquers</hi> (late Lat.).— </sense><sense id="n12385.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygiac Graecia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12385.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris et famae libido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debello: <entryFree id="n12386" type="main" key="de_bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-bello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n12386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (not ante-Aug.; esp. freq. in Livy). </sense><sense id="n12386.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to bring a war to an end, to finish a war</hi>. So rare in the act. form: <cit><quote lang="la">Aulius cum Ferentanis uno secundo proelio debellavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 35</bibl>. But exceedingly common as an impersonal: <cit><quote lang="la">debellari eo die cum Samnitibus potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne absente se debellaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelioque uno debellatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:48" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 48</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Drak.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debellatum est (erat, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debellatum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:11 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debellatum iri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf. absol.</hi> debellato, <hi rend="ital">after the war is ended</hi> (freq. in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">eum quasi debellato triumphare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12386.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.). * </sense><sense id="n12386.3" n="A" level="2"> With a homogeneous object, <hi rend="ital">to fight out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixa super mero debellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12386.4" n="B" level="2"> With heterog. object, <hi rend="ital">to conquer completely, to vanquish, subdue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcere subjectis et debellare superbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 853</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">gentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Darium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 17</bibl></cit>: Indiam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 605</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12386.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim fugissemus ex Asia, si nos fabulae debellare potuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debellat eos (fungos) et aceti natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debeo:
<entryFree id="n12387" type="main" key="de_be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">dehibeo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 24</bibl> <sense id="n12387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infra</hi>, cf. Ritschl, Opusc. Phil. 2, 590), <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de-habeo</etym>, (lit., <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep from some one</hi>: "qui pecuniam dissolvit, statim non <hi rend="ital">habet</hi> id quod reddidit, qui autem <hi rend="ital">debet</hi>, aes <hi rend="ital">retinet</hi> alienum," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 28, 68</bibl> Wund.; hence), <hi rend="ital">to owe</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)fei/lw</foreign>; opp. reddo, solvo, dissolvo, persolvo, freq. and class.).</sense><sense id="n12387.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of money and money's worth. </sense><sense id="n12387.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n12387.3" n="(a)" level="5"> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (drachmas) de ratione dehibuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mylasis et Alabandis pecuniam Cluvio debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dissolverem quae debeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatus es de pecunia, quam pro domo, pro hortis, pro sectione debebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grandem pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 3</bibl></cit>: quadringenties HS. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talenta CC,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadruplum, duplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 44</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12387.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis quibus debeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illi quam plurimi deberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipsi debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: Cal. Jan. debuit; <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc non solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 3</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <itype>debentes, ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">debtors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12387.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum pecunia accipitur, quae mihi ex publica permutatione debetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ad diem legioni frumentum deberi sciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a publicanis suae provinciae debitam biennii pecuniam exegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si omnino non debetur? Quid? praetor solet judicare deberi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeretur an debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12387.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēbĭ-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">what is owing, a debt</hi>, Cic. <cb n="DEBE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:13:23" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 13, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne de bonis deminui paterentur priusquam Fundanio debitum solutum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Q. Fr. 1:2:3:section=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam debito fraudetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Or. 53:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 53, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus unum haec epistula in debitum solvet,</quote> <trans><tr>will pay a debt with one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to repay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10</bibl></cit>, pr. 1.</sense><sense id="n12387.7" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">animan debere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be over head and ears in debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 3, 56</bibl></cit> ("Graecum proverbium, <foreign lang="greek">kai\ au)th
 th
 yuxh
 o)fei/lei</foreign>," Don.).</sense><sense id="n12387.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to owe</hi> something, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be under obligation</hi>, both <hi rend="ital">to</hi> and <hi rend="ital">for</hi> something.</sense><sense id="n12387.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To owe</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under obligation to render, pay</hi>, etc., something (for syn. cf.: necesse est, oportet, cogo, decet, opus est, par est, meum, tuum ... alicujus est). </sense><sense id="n12387.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12387.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12387.12" n="(a)" level="5"> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hoc tibi pro servitio debeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 4, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo etiam majorem ei res publica gratiam debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> b: <cit><quote lang="la">videris patriae hoc munus debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fidem debet tutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 73</bibl></cit> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 42</bibl>, si tutor <hi rend="ital">fidem praestare</hi> debet); cf. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> b: <cit><quote lang="la">dies longa videtur opus debentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos mundo debes oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debueram patriae poenas odiisque meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 853</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 538</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:648" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 648</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem nil jam caelestibus ullis debentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:371" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 371</bibl>: navis, quae tibi <hi rend="ital">creditum</hi> Debes Vergilium finibus Atticis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:481 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 481 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnum debent haec jam mihi sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 317</bibl></cit> Wagn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti tibi quid homines debent?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>what business have you with those men?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. infra b <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n12387.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf., to be bound, in duty bound</hi> to do something; <hi rend="ital">I ought, must, should</hi>, etc., do it (in class. prose always in the sense of moral necessity; in the poets sometimes for <hi rend="ital">necesse est</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">debetis velle quae velimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num ferre contra patriam arma illi cum Coriolano debuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo illa gravius aestimare debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam forte Tubero obtinere debebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debes hoc etiam rescribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut agri vastari, oppida expugnari non debuerint, Caes, B. G. 1, 11: summae se iniquitatis condemnari debere, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor ... inter perfectos veteresque referri debet, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41</bibl>: inter quos <hi rend="ital">referendus erit?</hi> cf. also ultima semper <hi rend="ital">Exspectanda</hi> dies homini; <cit><quote lang="la">dicique beatus Ante obitum nemo debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 137</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam nunc dicat, jam nunc debentia dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for necesse est, oportet, <hi rend="ital">it is necessary, it must needs</hi> (so almost everywhere in Lucret.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia debet enim cibus integrare novando et fulcire cibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 61</bibl>; 1, 232 Munro.—</sense><sense id="n12387.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., to be due</hi> or <hi rend="ital">owing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri jam et Libero reliquum tempus deberi arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta his (sc. dis) gratia debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores non ex merito, sed quasi debitos repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 37</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">persolvant grates dignas et praemia reddant Debita!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debita quam sulcis committas semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:60" default="NO">2, 28, 60</bibl> (3, 26, 14 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">debitae Nymphis opifex coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 27, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calentem debita sparges lacrima favillam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 9</bibl> (4, 6, 9 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">soli mihi Pallas debetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 443</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi istic debetur?</quote> <trans><tr>what business have you there?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 1, 34</bibl>; cf. supra, a </sense><sense id="n12387.15" n="(a)" level="5">.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēbĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">what is due, debt, duty, obligation</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">velut omni vitae debito liberatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotum nutriendorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non secundum gratiam, sed secundum debitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl> Cor. 7, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere debito,</quote> <trans><tr>to free from obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12387.16" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> (esp. in Verg.) and in post-Aug. prose like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)fei/lw</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">o)fliska/nw</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n12387.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To owe</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destined</hi> by fate or by nature (v. Lidd. and Scott sub. <foreign lang="greek">o)fei/lw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3). </sense><sense id="n12387.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act..</hi> urbem et jam cerno Phrygios debere nepotes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">are destined to found</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 444</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debet multas hic legibus aevi (i. e. fato) Ante suam mortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl>, <cb n="DEBI" /> 530.—More usually, </sense><sense id="n12387.19" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">pass., to be due</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be destined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui regnum Italiae Romanaque tellus Debentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 276</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 184</bibl>; 7, 120; <cit><quote lang="la">145: indigetem Aeneam scis Deberi caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 795</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae, quibus altera fato Corpora debentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors ista senectae Debita erat nostrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis debitus Arruns,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>devoted to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum bello Argolici vastabant Pergama reges Debita casurasque inimicis ignibus arces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 375</bibl></cit> ("<hi rend="ital">fataliter ad exitium destinata</hi>," Serv.); cf. so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora Parcae debita complerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo naturae debitum reddiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: DEBITVM NATVRAE PERSOLVIT, etc., Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3453; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply DEBITVM PERSOLVIT,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 4482.—</sense><sense id="n12387.20" n="b" level="4"> So, because what one is destined by the fates to suffer is regarded as his debt (<foreign lang="greek">o)fliska/nein ge/lwta/ tini</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">tu nisi ventis debes ludibrium, cave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 14, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12387.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To owe</hi> something to some one, <hi rend="ital">to be indebted to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to have to thank one for</hi> something. </sense><sense id="n12387.22" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc summum beneficium Q. Maximo debuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>; so magna beneficia mihi, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi laudem illam eo minus deberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me paene plus tibi quam ipsi Miloni debiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and quantum cuique deberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">o cui debere salutem Confiteor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 164</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so vitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a like sense: se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 644</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in a bad sense, hoc quoque Tarquinio debebimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fast. 2, 825</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12387.23" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to be indebted, obliged, under obligation</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">verum fac me multis debere, et in iis Plancio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with a clause: tibi nos debere fatemur, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12387.24" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To continue to owe</hi> something; i. e. <hi rend="ital">to withhold, keep back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod praesenti tibi non tribueram, id absenti debere non potui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—So <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim diximus, et tibi hoc video non posse debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
debibo: <entryFree id="n12388" type="hapax" key="de_bi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to drink of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debilis: <entryFree id="n12389" type="main" key="de_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭlis</orth> (old shortened form <sense id="n12389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">debil</hi>, v. Ritschl, Opusc. Phil. 2, 331), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>de-habilis; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 4, § 12</bibl>: lit. <hi rend="ital">unmanageable, wanting in flexibility</hi> or <hi rend="ital">activity;</hi> hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">lame, disabled, crippled, infirm, debilitated, feeble, frail, weak</hi>, etc. For syn. cf.: imbecillus, infirmus, invalidus (freq. and class.).</sense><sense id="n12389.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12389.2" n="a" level="4"> Of personal subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">debiles fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:10" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si gladium imbecillo seni aut debili dederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confectus senectute, mancus et membris omnibus captus ac debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: debilis manu, pede, coxa, Maecen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 11</bibl>; ille humero, hic lumbis, hic coxa debilis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimis stipendiis debilis miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integris debiles implicabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissis remis atque ordine debilis uno Sergestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudi ac debiles equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12389.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects: membra metu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">debile fit corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 952</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:830" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 830</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 106</bibl></cit>: crus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 3, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of a wounded man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:144" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 144</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12389.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">disabled, weak</hi>, in mind, character, authority, etc. </sense><sense id="n12389.5" n="a" level="4"> Of personal subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">eos qui restitissent infirmos sine illo (sc.
