Catilina) ac debiles fore putabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hac parte animi (sc. memoria) tam debilis esset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 61, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio debilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: sine animo anima est debilis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 426, 48</bibl> (v. 296 Ribbeck).—</sense><sense id="n12389.6" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">duo corpora esse reipublicae, unum debile, infirmo capite: alterum firmum sine capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manca ac debilis praetura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, sine quibus trunca esset actio ac debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: inscitia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:99" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 99</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> appears not to occur.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">infirmly, lamely, feebly</hi>: lacrimis lingua debiliter stupet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 18</bibl> (v. 355 Ribbeck).</sense></entryFree>
debilitas: <entryFree id="n12390" type="main" key="de_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>debilis</etym>, <sense id="n12390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lameness</hi>, <pb n="516" /> <cb n="DEBI" /> <hi rend="ital">debility, infirmity, weakness</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n12390.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 2</bibl></cit>: pedis, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: aliqua corporis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum integritas corporis, miserum debilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 9 al.</bibl>— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se dolores, morbos, debilitates repellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 1, 7</bibl>; Arnob. 1, 46 sq.—</sense><sense id="n12390.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis debilitate Galliambus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debilitatio: <entryFree id="n12391" type="main" key="de_bi^li^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭlĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laming, maiming; weakness</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n12391.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium debilitationis consecutus, i. e. of mutilation of nose and ears,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12391.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
debiliter: <entryFree id="n12392" type="main" key="de_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. debilis, <sense id="n12392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ad fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
debilito: <entryFree id="n12393" type="main" key="de_bi^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>debilis</etym>, <sense id="n12393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lame, cripple, maim; to debilitate, unnerve, disable, weaken</hi> (freq. and class.).</sense><sense id="n12393.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12393.2" n="a" level="4"> Of personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores, qui debilitati fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=146" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contusi ac debilitati inter saxa rupesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore debilitantur (saucii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu debilitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: lapsu debilitatus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl> (cf. shortly after, qui et ipse <hi rend="ital">crus fregerat</hi>): qui filium debilitavit, ut <hi rend="ital">inhabilis</hi> militiae sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 4, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natantium manus lacerabant, donec debilitati, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12393.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">membra, quae debilitavit lapidibus, fustibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim ferro ac viribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 3</bibl></cit>: lingua Debilitata malis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes adversariorum debilitatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum etiam saepe subtrahunt, ut fame debilitetur eculeorum nimis effrenata vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Hortens. Frag. 78</bibl></cit> Bait. (Non., p. 105, 7).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: (hiems) quae nunc oppositis debilitat pumicibus mare Tyrrhenum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">breaks its waves</hi> ( = collidit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 11, 5</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12393.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12393.5" n="a" level="4"> Of personal objects: quo metu debilitaret nostros, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulac me fractum ac debilitatum metu viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cum afflictum, debilitatum, maerentem, viderem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitatis literis debilitatus atque abjectus, conscientia convictus, repente conticuit,</quote> <trans><tr>disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victi debilitantur animosque demittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aestivorum timor te debilitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam continet metus, quosdam debilitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: debilitati a jure cognoscendo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dispirited, discouraged</hi> ( = deterriti), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 142</bibl> (cf. shortly before, a discendo deterrent).—</sense><sense id="n12393.6" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">membrum reip. fractum debilitatumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum luctu, metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 103</bibl></cit>: nimis effrenatam vim fame, id. fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 11</bibl>; cf.: vires animi (senectus), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 611</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinem, magnitudinem animi, patientiam (dolor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem multis incommodis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debilitatur ac frangitur eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debitio: <entryFree id="n12394" type="main" key="de_bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>debeo</etym>, <sense id="n12394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an owing, indebtedness</hi> (extremely rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae et gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 28, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 2 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquetur debitione dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the debt</hi>, Ambros. de Tobia, 7, 25.</sense></entryFree>
debitor: <entryFree id="n12395" type="main" key="de_bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a debtor;</hi> cf.: nexus, obaeratus. </sense><sense id="n12395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (quite class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 20, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 84</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 40</bibl> et saep.: aeris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12395.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n12395.3" n="A" level="2"> (after debeo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.): voti, one whose wish has been granted, and <hi rend="ital">who is</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">bound to perform his vow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:42:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 42, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercede soluta Non manet officio debitor ille tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 1, 14</bibl>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n12395.4" n="B" level="2"> (after debeo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.), <hi rend="ital">one who is indebted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under obligation to some one for something;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen. of the thing</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">dat. of the person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui debitor est vitae tibi suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: animi amici, <cb n="DECA" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebis ipsum gratissimum debitorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
debitrix: <entryFree id="n12396" type="main" key="de_bi^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>debitor</etym>, <sense id="n12396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female debtor</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n12396.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:47" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 14, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12396.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium delictorum debitrix anima est,</quote> <trans><tr>the guilty cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
debitum: <entryFree id="n12397" type="main" key="de_bi^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēbĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. debeo.</entryFree>
deblatero: <entryFree id="n12398" type="main" key="de_bla^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-blătĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to prate of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to babble, blab out</hi> (ante and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">versuum multa milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
debucino: <entryFree id="n12399" type="main" key="de_bu_ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-būcĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">debuccino</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to trumpet forth</hi> (eccl. Lat.), trop., Tert. virg. vel. 13.</sense></entryFree>
decachinno: <entryFree id="n12400" type="main" key="de_ca^chinno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-căchinno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to deride, laugh to scorn</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decachordum: <entryFree id="n12401" type="main" key="de^ca^chordum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcăchordum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">deka/xordon</foreign>, <sense id="n12401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical instrument of ten strings</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:91:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 91, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decachordus: <entryFree id="n12402" type="main" key="de^ca^chordus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcăchordus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">deka/xordos</foreign>, <sense id="n12402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ten-stringed</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 14 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
decacuminatio: <entryFree id="n12403" type="hapax" key="de_ca^cu_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcăcūmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decacumino</etym>, <sense id="n12403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lopping, cutting off the top</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressi, piceae, cedri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decacumino: <entryFree id="n12404" type="main" key="de_ca^cu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-căcūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cut the top off, to top and lop</hi> (t. t. of agriculture): <cit><quote lang="la">pampinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decalantico: <entryFree id="n12405" type="hapax" key="de_ca^lanti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-călantĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>calantica</etym>, <sense id="n12405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of one's hood, to plunder</hi> one: decalanticare, eburno speculo depeculassere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 9</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
decalco: <entryFree id="n12406" type="gloss" key="de_calco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcalco</orth>, <sense id="n12406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plaster with lime, to whitewash</hi> = albo, <foreign lang="greek">koniw=</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
decalefacio: <entryFree id="n12407" type="gloss" key="de_ca^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcălĕfăcĭo</orth>, <sense id="n12407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm thoroughly</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)kqermai/nw</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
decalesco: <entryFree id="n12408" type="gloss" key="de_ca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcălesco</orth>, <sense id="n12408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become warm</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)kqermai/nomai</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
decalicator: <entryFree id="n12409" type="gloss" key="de_ca^li^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcălĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>de-calix</etym>, <sense id="n12409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hard drinker</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">katapo/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
decalicatum: <entryFree id="n12410" type="gloss" key="de_ca^li^ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcălĭcātum</orth>, <itype>calce litum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 13</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
decalogus: <entryFree id="n12411" type="main" key="de^ca^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcălŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">deka/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n12411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the decalogue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> An. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decalvatio: <entryFree id="n12412" type="main" key="de_calva_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcalvātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decalvo</etym>, <sense id="n12412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the making bald</hi>, Hieron. Ep. 122, 1.</sense></entryFree>
decalvo: <entryFree id="n12413" type="main" key="de_calvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-calvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (calvus], <sense id="n12413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bald, to remove the hair</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">locum corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 2, 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sampson a muliere decalvatus,</quote> <trans><tr>shorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros David decalvavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 19, 4</bibl></cit>; 1 Cor. 11, 6.</sense></entryFree>
decania: <entryFree id="n12414" type="main" key="de^ca_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcānĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decanus</etym>, <sense id="n12414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divisions of the zodiac</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decanicum: <entryFree id="n12415" type="main" key="de^ca_ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcānĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a building belonging to the church</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 16, 5, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decano: <entryFree id="n12416" type="main" key="de_ca^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-căno</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to celebrate by singing</hi>: Cererem, Prob. Cath. 1492 P.</sense></entryFree>
decantatio: <entryFree id="n12417" type="hapax" key="de_canta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decanto</etym>, <sense id="n12417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talkativeness</hi>, as transl. of <foreign lang="greek">a)dolesxi/a</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 106</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 49.</sense></entryFree>
decanto: <entryFree id="n12418" type="main" key="de_canto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-canto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (in the class. per. freq. in Cic.; elsewh. rare). <sense id="n12418.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sing</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">off, to repeat in a singing manner</hi> (v. cano and canto). </sense><sense id="n12418.1" n="A" level="2"> Usually with the secondary idea of something trite, worn out, absurd; <hi rend="ital">to repeat often, to say over and over again</hi> ( = semper repetere, in ore habere; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cantilena): nec mihi opus est Graeco aliquo doctore, qui mihi pervulgata praecepta decantet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 64 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12418.2" n="B" level="2"> Without this unfavorable idea: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabiles elegos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">*(/alwsin</foreign> Ilii in scenico habitu, <hi rend="ital">to recite, rehearse</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to proclaim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 394</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12418.3" n="C" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to repeat as a charm</hi>, and hence <hi rend="ital">to bewitch, enchant, charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo decantatus carmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis et amplexibus aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 165, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl>, p. 137, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:54:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 54, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12418.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Intr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12418.5" n="A" level="2"> (<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> to <hi rend="ital">de, no.</hi> II. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">To leave off singing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam decantaverant ( = cantare, deplorare desierant),</quote> <trans><tr>had given over lamenting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12418.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To play</hi> (upon an instrument): <cit><quote lang="la">decantandi jus tibicinibus ademit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Illust. 34:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Illust. 34, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decanus: <entryFree id="n12419" type="main" key="de^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decem</etym>. <sense id="n12419.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chief of ten, one set over ten persons</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n12419.1" n="A" level="2"> Over soldiers, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12419.2" n="B" level="2"> Over monks, <hi rend="ital">a dean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 35.—</sense><sense id="n12419.3" n="C" level="2"> <cb n="DECE" /> <hi rend="ital">The chief of the corpse-bearers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12419.4" n="D" level="2"> As a judge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 18, 21</bibl>; Deut. 1, 15.—</sense><sense id="n12419.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of officer at the imperial court</hi>, Cod. 12, 27, 1.—</sense><sense id="n12419.6" n="III" level="1"> In astrology, <hi rend="ital">the chief of ten parts of a zodiacal sign</hi>, Firm. Math. 2, 4.</sense></entryFree>
decaproti: <entryFree id="n12420" type="greek" key="de^ca_^pro_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcā^prōti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">deka/prwtoi</foreign>, <sense id="n12420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ten chief men</hi>, magistrates in the municipia and colonies (pure Lat. decem primi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:3:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:section=26" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decaprotia: <entryFree id="n12421" type="greek" key="de^ca_^pro_ti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcā^prōtīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dekaprwtei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n12421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of the</hi> decaproti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decargyrum: <entryFree id="n12422" type="main" key="de^cargy^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcargyrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large silver coin</hi> ( = majorina), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 9, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decarmino: <entryFree id="n12423" type="main" key="de_carmi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcarmĭno</orth>, <itype>avi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de-carmen</etym>, <sense id="n12423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make prose</hi> of verse, <hi rend="ital">to disarrange the order of the words</hi> in a verse: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hic ordo nobis verborum faciendus est, ut versus hujus decarminata contextio ipsa se magis exponere videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 130, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decarno: <entryFree id="n12424" type="main" key="de_carno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-carno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2, caro</etym>, <sense id="n12424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take off the flesh</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 2, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decas: <entryFree id="n12425" type="greek" key="de^cas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">deka/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decade</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Praescr. 49 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 734</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decastylos: <entryFree id="n12426" type="gloss" key="de^casty^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcastylos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">deka/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n12426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having ten columns, decastyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
decaulesco: <entryFree id="n12427" type="hapax" key="de_caulesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-caulesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>caulis</etym>, <sense id="n12427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form a stem, run to stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raphanus antequam decaulescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decebalus: <entryFree id="n12428" type="main" key="De^ce^ba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĕbălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*deke/balos</foreign>, <sense id="n12428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Dacian king, subdued by Trajan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decedo:
<entryFree id="n12429" type="main" key="de_ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n12429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. sync.</hi> decesse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl>; Neue Formenl. 2, 536. The <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> decessus perh. only <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Nam. 1, 313</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. n., to go away, depart, withdraw</hi>. (For syn. cf.: linquo, relinquo, desero, destituo, deficio, discedo, excedo. Often opp. to accedo, maneo; freq. and class.)—Constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">de, ex</hi>, or merely the <case>abl.</case>; rarely with <hi rend="ital">ab.</hi></sense><sense id="n12429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12429.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">decedamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de altera parte (agri) decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedit ex Gallia Romam Naevius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e pastu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 381</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e pastu decedere campis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aequore domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 205</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">23, 1: pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 29</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de praesidio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae naves paullulum suo cursu decesserint,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had gone out of their course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum luminibus exstinctis decessisset viā,</quote> <trans><tr>had gone out of the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantherae constituisse dicuntur in Cariam ex nostra provincia decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12429.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n12429.4" n="1" level="3"> t. t. </sense><sense id="n12429.5" n="a" level="4"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to retire, withdraw</hi> from a former position: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nisi decedat atque exercitum deducat ex his regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <trans><tr>absol</tr>.,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de colle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 71, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco superiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>; so with <case>abl.</case>, Auct. B. Alex. 34; 35 (twice); 70 al.— </sense><sense id="n12429.6" n="b" level="4"> In official lang.: de provincia, ex provincia, provinciā, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 26, 65</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to retire from the province</hi> on the expiration of a term of office: <cit><quote lang="la">de provincia decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">decedens ex Syria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">e Cilicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Asia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ea provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut decedens Considius provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te antea, quam tibi successum esset, decessurum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:65 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 26, 65 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albinus Romam decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam ad triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 16</bibl>. —Rarely with <hi rend="ital">a</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cum respondissem, me a provincia decedere: etiam mehercule, inquit, ut opinor, ex Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n12429.7" n="2" level="3"> Decedere <hi rend="ital">de viā;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">viā, in viā alicui, alicui</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol., to get out of the way, to give place, make way</hi> for one (as a mark of respect or of abhorrence): <cit><quote lang="la">concedite atque abscedite omnes: de via decedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decedam ego illi de via, de semita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 80</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59</bibl>. <pb n="517" /> <cb n="DECE" /> 163; cf. II. B infra); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fecit servo currenti in viā decesse populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorem L. Plancum via sibi decedere aedilis coegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctis divis, Catul. 62, 268: nocti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Ec. 8, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 216</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cedere nocti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 7</bibl></cit>).—Also, <hi rend="ital">to get out of the way of, avoid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedere canibus de via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi numero impiorum habentur, his omnes decedunt, aditum defugiunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—By zeugma, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutari, appeti, decedi, assurgi, deduci, reduci, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12429.8" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to depart, disappear</hi> (cf.: cedo, concedo). </sense><sense id="n12429.9" n="a" level="4"> Of living beings, <hi rend="ital">to decease, to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eos, qui jam de vita decesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:57:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 57, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Mac. 6, 31; but commonly <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater nobis decessit a. d. VIII. Kal. Dec.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paterfamiliae decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 3, 2</bibl>, and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 96</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruditate contracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo aquae intercutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paralysi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ingratorum hominum conspectu morte decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12429.10" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to depart, go off; to abate, subside, cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quartana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2</bibl></cit> (opp. accedere): <cit><quote lang="la">decessisse inde aquam,</quote> <trans><tr>run off, fallen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decedere aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summa nihil decedet,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wanting, to fail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 167</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid libertati plebis caveretur, id suis decedere opibus credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedet jam ira haec, etsi merito iratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 15</bibl>: cito ab eo haec ira <hi rend="ital">abscedet</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam invidia decesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 16 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam ea cura decederet patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipit et longo Scyros decedere ponto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>seems to flee before them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:308" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 308</bibl></cit>.—In the Aug. poets sometimes of the heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">to go down, set</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sol crescentes decedens duplicat umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 67</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 91</bibl>; hence also of the day, <hi rend="ital">to depart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te veniente die, te decedente canebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 466</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also of the moon,</quote> <trans><tr>to wane</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12429.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12429.12" n="A" level="2"> De possessione, jure, sententia, fide, etc. (and since the Aug. per. with <case>abl.</case> alone; <cit><quote lang="la">the reading ex jure suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 10</bibl></cit>, is very doubtful), <hi rend="ital">to depart from; to give up, resign, forego; to yield, to swerve from</hi> one's possession, station, duty, right, opinion, faith, etc. </sense><sense id="n12429.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogere aliquem de suis bonis decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de hypothecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and de possessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">de suo jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de civitate decedere quam de sententia maluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de officio ac dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de foro decedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to retire from public life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de scena,</quote> <trans><tr>to retire from the stage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de officio decessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12429.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> alone (so usually in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">jure suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituto vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officio (opp. in fide atque officio pristino fore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:22" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poema ... si paulum summo decessit, vergit ad imum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 378</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12429.15" n="(g)" level="5"> Very rarely with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (senatus) nihil a superioribus continuorum annorum decretis decesserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12429.16" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: si quos equites decedentis nactus sum, supplicio adfeci, Asin. Pol. ap. C. Fam. 10, 32, 5.</sense><sense id="n12429.17" n="B" level="2"> De via, <hi rend="ital">to depart, deviate from the right way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se nulla cupiditate inductum de via decessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moleste ferre se de via decessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">viā dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12429.18" n="C" level="2"> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2) <hi rend="ital">To give way, yield</hi> to another (i. e. to his will or superior advantages—very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vivere si recte nescis, decede peritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi non Hymetto Mella decedunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are not inferior</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12429.19" n="D" level="2"> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <hi rend="ital">To avoid, shun, escape from</hi> (cf. I. B. 2 supra): nec serae meminit decedere nocti, <hi rend="ital">to avoid the late night</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the coldness of night</hi>, Varius ap. Macr. S. <cb n="DECE" /> 6, 2, 20; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Ecl. 8, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 467</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12429.20" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall short of, degenerate from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de generis nobilitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: a rebus gestis ejus et gloriae splendore, Justin. 6, 3, 8.</sense>
* <sense id="n12429.21" n="III" level="1"> For the simple verb (v. cedo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. 2), <hi rend="ital">to go off, turn out, result</hi> in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">prospere decedentibus rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decelea: <entryFree id="n12430" type="main" key="De^ce^le_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĕlēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*deke/leia</foreign>, <sense id="n12430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demos in Attica</hi>, 120 <hi rend="ital">stadia from the Boeotian frontier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 7</bibl>; Frontin. Strat. 1, 3, 9.</sense></entryFree>
decello: <entryFree id="n12431" type="hapax" key="de_cello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cello</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = declino, <sense id="n12431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn aside, deviate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 219</bibl> Lachm. ex conj. (better depellere, with the MSS. v. Munro ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
decem: <entryFree id="n12432" type="main" key="de^cem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem</orth> (DEKEM, Corp. Inscr. Lat. 1, 844 al.—The best MSS. and editt. vacillate often between the word and its sign X), <sense id="n12432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num.</hi> [Sanscr. and Zend, daçan, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/ka</foreign>, Old H. Germ. zëhan, Germ. zehn, Eng. ten], <hi rend="ital">ten</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12432.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">decem minae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit> and 58: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum milia decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi decem et tres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rose. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia passuum decem novem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 58</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12432.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Decem primi</orth> (separated thus in the inscrr.), or in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcemprīmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the heads or presidents of the ten decuriae which usually formed the senate in an Italian city or Roman colony</hi> (afterwards called decaproti, v. h. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus et decem primi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 642</bibl> and 1848. <hi rend="ital">Their dignity</hi> was termed <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-prīmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also decaprotia, v. h. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12432.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, for an indefinite, round number: <cit><quote lang="la">si decem habeas linguas, mutum esse addecet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat saepe ducentos, Saepe decem servos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: cf.: decies.</sense></entryFree>
december: <entryFree id="n12433" type="main" key="De^cember" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcember</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decem and -ber, = fer, Sanscr. bhar, to carry, bear: cf. Septem-ber, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n12433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tenth month of the Roman year</hi>, reckoned from March, and consequently our twelfth, <hi rend="ital">December</hi> (containing, as now, 31 days): "dehinc quintus (mensis) <hi rend="ital">Quintilis</hi> et sic deinceps usque ad Decembrem a numero," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 34</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptus Geniis December (on account of the Saturnalia celebrated in this month),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fumosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:491" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 491</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12433.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adesset senatus frequens a. d. VIII. Kalendas Decembres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonae Decembres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idibus Decembribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>: libertate Decembri utere (i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the Saturnalia</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12433.2" n="II" level="1"> As closing the year, meton. for <hi rend="ital">the</hi> (past) <hi rend="ital">year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tertius December, ex quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me quater undenos implevisse Decembres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12433.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcember</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 241</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">676 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:41:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 41, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decemjugis: <entryFree id="n12434" type="main" key="de^cemju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-jŭgis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jugum</etym>.—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n12434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., ten-yoked;</hi> hence (with currus understood), <hi rend="ital">a ten-horse chariot</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Buleng. de Circo, 55.</sense></entryFree>
decemmestris: <entryFree id="n12435" type="main" key="de^cemmestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-mestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis; cf.: bimestris, trimestris</etym>, <sense id="n12435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ten months</hi>: annus, Censorin. 11; 20.</sense></entryFree>
decemmodius: <entryFree id="n12436" type="main" key="de^cemmo^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-mŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., containing ten modii</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corbulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemmŏdĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (al. decimodiae, sc. corbulae), <hi rend="ital">baskets holding each ten modii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decempeda: <entryFree id="n12437" type="main" key="de^cempe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-pĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n12437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ten-foot measuring rod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 126</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 15, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
decempedalis: <entryFree id="n12438" type="main" key="de^cempe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcempĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decem-pes</etym>, <sense id="n12438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ten feet long</hi>: spatium, Cod. 11, 42, 6.</sense></entryFree>
decempedator: <entryFree id="n12439" type="hapax" key="de^cempe^da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcempĕdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decempeda</etym>, <sense id="n12439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a land-measurer, land-surveyor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decemplex: <entryFree id="n12440" type="main" key="de^cemplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-plex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plico</etym>, <sense id="n12440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tenfold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 43</bibl> Müll: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decemplicatus: <entryFree id="n12441" type="hapax" key="de^cempli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemplĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decem-plex</etym>, <sense id="n12441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">multiplied by ten, ten times over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 38</bibl> Müll. <cb n="DECE" /></sense></entryFree>
decemprimatus: <entryFree id="n12442" type="main" key="de^cempri_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemprīmātus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemprīmi</orth>, v. decem, <sense id="n12442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.</sense></entryFree>
decemremis: <entryFree id="n12443" type="hapax" key="de^cemre_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-rēmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remus; cf.: biremis, triremis</etym>, lit. <sense id="n12443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ten-oared</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">having ten banks of oars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sc. navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decemscalmus: <entryFree id="n12444" type="hapax" key="decemscalmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">decem-scalmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scalmus</etym>, lit. <sense id="n12444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ten-thowled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">having ten oars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actuariola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; Orell, <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decemvir: <entryFree id="n12445" type="main" key="de^cemvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemvir</orth>, v. decemviri.</entryFree>
decemviralis: <entryFree id="n12446" type="main" key="de^cemvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decemviri</etym>, <sense id="n12446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">decemviral, of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the decem viri</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Twelve Tables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37</bibl></cit> invidia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certaminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex collegio (sacerdotes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia (referring to the decemviri agris dividundis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemvĭrālĭter</orth>: loqui, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the manner of the</hi> decemviri stlitibus judicandis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
decemviratus: <entryFree id="n12447" type="main" key="de^cemvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcemvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decemviri</etym>, <sense id="n12447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the decemvirate, the rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of a decemvir;</hi> with regard to the decemv. agr. divid., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with regard to the decemv. legib. scrib.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
decemviri: <entryFree id="n12448" type="main" key="de^cemvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcem-vĭri</orth> (in MSS. and old edd. often Xviri), um or ōrum (<sense id="n12448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>-virum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 85</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 12</bibl>: -virorum only in Liv., where it is very freq.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a college</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commission of ten men, the decemviri</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decemvirs</hi>, Roman magistrates of various kinds. </sense><sense id="n12448.1" n="I" level="1"> The most famous were called decemviri legibus scribundis, <hi rend="ital">the composers of the Twelve Tables</hi>, who ruled alone, and absolutely, in the years of Rome 303 to 305 (legally only 303 and 304; hence "neque decemviralis potestas ultra biennium," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes">46</bibl>; 48 al. The fragments which remain of these laws form one of the most important monuments of the early Latin language; and have been critically edited by R. Schoell, Leips., 1866; cf. Momms. Rom. Hist. book 2, ch. 2; Lange, Röm. Alter. 1, 535 sqq.; Wordsworth, Fragm. p. 503 sq.—</sense><sense id="n12448.2" n="II" level="1"> Decemviri stlitibus (litibus) judicandis, <hi rend="ital">a standing tribunal for deciding causes involving liberty or citizenship, and which represented the praetor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 29</bibl>; Corp. Inscr. Lat. 8, 38 (A. U. C. 615); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caec. 33, 97</bibl>. —In the <number>sing.</number>, Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 133 and 554. —</sense><sense id="n12448.3" n="III" level="1"> Decemviri agris dividundis, <hi rend="ital">a commission for distributing the public land to the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 4</bibl> and 42; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">X. VIR. A. D. A. (i. e. decemviri agris dandis assignandis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 544</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12448.4" n="IV" level="1"> Decemviri sacris faciundis, <hi rend="ital">a college of priests who preserved the Sibylline books, had charge of the Apollinaria</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">its number in the time of the emperors was increased to sixty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 12 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 554</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decennalis: <entryFree id="n12449" type="main" key="de^cenna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcennālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decem-annus</etym>, <sense id="n12449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ten years, decennial</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">decennis): bellum, i. e. Caesar's in Gaul,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Trojan war,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12449.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: DECENNALIA (ium, <gen>n.</gen>), <hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated every ten years after the time of Augustus</hi>, Trebell. Gallien. 21, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 116, 4</bibl>; v. decennis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decennis: <entryFree id="n12450" type="main" key="de^cennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ten years</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum, of the Greeks before Troy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also proelium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidio (Veiorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <trans><tr>ten years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:44:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decenni major asinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12450.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">decennia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = decennalia, <hi rend="ital">a festival under the emperors, held every ten years</hi>, Treb. Gall. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: decennalis, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>
decennium: <entryFree id="n12451" type="main" key="de^cenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decennis</etym>. <sense id="n12451.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A period of ten years</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo. Socr. p. 52, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12451.1" n="II" level="1"> i. q. decennalia, Trebell. Gallien. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decennovalis: <entryFree id="n12452" type="main" key="de^cenno^va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcennŏvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decem novem</etym>, <sense id="n12452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of nineteen years</hi>: cyclus, Cassiod., comp. pasch.</sense></entryFree>
decennovium: <entryFree id="n12453" type="main" key="De^cenno^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcennŏvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decem-novem</etym>, <pb n="518" /> <cb n="DECE" /> <sense id="n12453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Pomptine Marshes</hi> (19,000 feet in length), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 152, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decens: <entryFree id="n12454" type="main" key="de^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>decet</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
