decenter: <entryFree id="n12455" type="main" key="de^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcenter</orth>, v. decet, <sense id="n12455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
decentia: <entryFree id="n12456" type="main" key="de^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decens</etym>, <sense id="n12456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comeliness, decency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorum et figurarum (with venustas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decentius: <entryFree id="n12457" type="main" key="De^centi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcentĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general of Magnentius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 7</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcentĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., pertaining to Decentius.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcen-tiăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his adherents</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deceptio: <entryFree id="n12458" type="main" key="de_ceptio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēceptio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decipio</etym>, <sense id="n12458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiving, deception</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; Cod. 11, 47, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl>. Macc. 16, 17.— </sense><sense id="n12458.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Deceitfulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 4, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deceptor: <entryFree id="n12459" type="main" key="de_ceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiver</hi> (late Lat. for fraudator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 140" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 140</bibl>; Lact. de Ira, 4, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Serm. 362, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deceptorius: <entryFree id="n12460" type="main" key="de_cepto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēceptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceitful, deceptive</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deceptrix: <entryFree id="n12461" type="main" key="de_ceptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēceptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deceptor</etym>, <sense id="n12461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that deceives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciosa adulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
deceptus: <entryFree id="n12462" type="main" key="de_ceptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of decipio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12463" type="main" key="de_ceptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēceptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decipio</etym>, <sense id="n12463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deception</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deceptui facilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deceris: <entryFree id="n12464" type="greek" key="de^ce_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dekh/rhs</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">nau=s</foreign>), <sense id="n12464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ten-oared ship</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a ship having ten banks of oars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liburnicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit> (acc. to a conject. of Turneb. Adv. 22, 30; <hi rend="ital">lect. vulg.</hi> de cedris).</sense></entryFree>
decermina: <entryFree id="n12465" type="main" key="de_cermi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcermĭna</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decerpo</etym>, <sense id="n12465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaves and boughs plucked off;</hi> decermina dicuntur quae decerpuntur purgandi causa, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 7</bibl> Müll.; hence <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Fortunae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beggars</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">the refuse of Fortune</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decerno: <entryFree id="n12466" type="main" key="de_cerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cerno</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype> (the syncop. forms decreram, etc., decrerim, etc., decresse are freq. in Cicero and Liv., also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 15</bibl>, but not in Caes., where is only decreverat, B. G. 4, 17; 5, 5 <sense id="n12466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 5, 53, 2), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen></sense><sense id="n12466.1" n="I" level="1"> (acc. to cerno, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To decide, determine</hi> any thing disputed or doubtful. For syn. cf.: scisco, jubeo, statuo, constituo, dico, sancio, consilium capio, destino, obstino, definio, determino.</sense><sense id="n12466.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., of a judge, magistrate, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pronounce a decision</hi> respecting something; <hi rend="ital">to decide, judge, determine, decree; to vote for</hi> any thing (very freq. and class.).—Const. with <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">acc. et inf.</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">relat. clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias (Verres praetor) revocabat eos, inter quos jam decreverat decretumque mutabat, alias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod est admissum facinus, si caedes facta, idem (Druides) decernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules de consilii sententia decreverunt secundum Buthrotios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, § 11: decernere vindicias secundum servitutem, <hi rend="ital">in favor of slavery</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">restore the slave to his master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatus triumphum Africano decerneret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a single senator: non decrevi solum, sed etiam ut vos decerneretis laboravi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so supplicationem decernere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also: Crassus tres legatos decernit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">D. Junius silanus supplicium sumendum decreverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando id bellum senatus decrevisset, quando id bellum populus R. jussisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:36" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod senatus me auctore decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ordo decrevit invitus,</quote> <trans><tr>on compulsion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligures ambobus consulibus decernuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Liv. 42, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam desponsam non decretam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 15</bibl></cit> (v. the whole passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae privatis decernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex annuo sumptu, qui mihi decretus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea virtute atque diligentia perditorum hominum patefactam esse conjurationem decrevistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: cum pontifices decressent ita; <cit><quote lang="la">SI, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus decrevit populusque jussit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: in <cb n="DECE" /> jure dicundo, ita decrevit, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of individuals: Hortensii et mea et Luculli sententia ... tibi decernit, ut regem reducas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parricidas rei publicae decretum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 51:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Cat. 51, 25</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of the emperor, <hi rend="ital">to determine the law</hi> by deciding a case: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque imperator cognoscens decrevit, legem esse constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12466.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the judicial sphere, <hi rend="ital">to decide, determine, judge</hi>: qui nequeas nostrorum uter sit Amphitruo decernere, Plaut. fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 285, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem dubiam decrevit vox opportune emissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primus clamor atque impetus rem decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 46, § 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de his Catonis praecepta decernent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo talenta pro re nostra ego esse decrevi satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam decrerim me non posse diutius habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo omnia mea posita esse decrevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum decrerunt dignum, suos cui liberos committerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ejus controversiis quid decernas, non a te peto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 59</bibl></cit>: aliquem decernere hostem, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim one an enemy</hi> by a formal decree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 7, 16</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo satis decernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12466.4" n="B" level="2"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">to decide by combat;</hi> hence (like cernere and certare), in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fight, combat, contend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra castris conferamus, et Samnis Romanusne imperio Italiam regant, decernamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 23, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso illo gladiatorio vitae certamine, quod ferro decernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 33</bibl>: de bello decernere, Auct. B. Hisp. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne armis decernatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro ancipiti decernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">and armis, ferro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 218</bibl></cit>; 12, 282; 695 (cf. et <hi rend="ital">cernere</hi> ferro, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 709</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cursibus et crudo caestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornibus inter se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidibus et subselliorum fragminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra magnam vim hostium, artificio magis quam viribus, Auct. B. Afr. 14: acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio cum proditore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classe decreturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integriore exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decernendi potestatem Pompeio fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12466.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">decernite criminibus, mox ferro decreturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—So of a judicial contest: <cit><quote lang="la">uno judicio de fortunis omnibus decernit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and qui judicio decernent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de salute reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro mea omni fama fortunisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam meo solum capite decernerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12466.6" n="II" level="1"> With reference to one's own acts, <hi rend="ital">to decide, determine on</hi> doing something; <hi rend="ital">to determine, resolve on</hi> something (freq. in all periods and styles).—Constr., with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> and with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu fluctus e gurgite tollere decreris, Lucil. ap. Rufin. § 26 (p. 238 ed. Frotsch.): quicquid peperisset decreverunt tollere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar his de causis Rhenum transire decreverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos me decretum est persequi mores patris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 56</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certum atque decretum est non dare signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquam aetatem a republica procul habendam decrevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4</bibl></cit>. With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subjunct.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic decernit ut miser sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">accus.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam decernere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-crētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n12466.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. A.) <hi rend="ital">A decree, decision, ordinance</hi> of any political or judicial body (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scitum, edictum, consilium, jus): senatus Caelium ab rep. removendum censuit. Hoc decreto eum consul senatu prohibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui eorum (sc. Druidum) decreto non stetit, sacrificiis interdicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">10: vestra responsa atque decreta evertuntur saepe dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—Esp. leg. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a decision</hi> of the emperor as judge, <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi> (cf. rescriptum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 15, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12466.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in philos. lang. as a translation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">do/gma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">principle, doctrine, precept</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 29; cf. <cb n="DECE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 2 sq.</bibl> and 95, 9 sq. (quis philoso, phorum) decretis suis paret? <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decerpo: <entryFree id="n12467" type="main" key="de_cerpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cerpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>carpo</etym>, <sense id="n12467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pluck off, to tear, pull</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">break off, to crop, gather</hi> (class.; most freq. in the poets.—Constr., usually aliquid ex aliqua re; less freq. aliquid de aliqua re). </sense><sense id="n12467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">acina de uvis decerpito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:112:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 112, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novos flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 927</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">undique decerptam fronti praeponere olivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbore pomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 536</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 3, 5, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and auricomos fetus arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetenuia fila ex abietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 128</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">lilia tenero ungui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pollice florem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:255" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 255</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and aurea poma manu mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 649</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:253" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 253</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">floret (thymum) circa solstitia, cum et apes decerpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 31, § 56</bibl></cit>; Catull. 64, 316.—</sense><sense id="n12467.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (omnia) nisi cotidie decerpantur arescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanus animus decerptus ex mente divina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid jocus de gravitate decerperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (materiarum) nunc facillima decerpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: oscula mordenti semper decerpere rostro, Catull. 68, 127 (cf.: carpo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. 1); <cit><quote lang="la">for which, ora puellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cop. 33</bibl></cit> Sillig.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12467.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12467.4" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to carpo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To enjoy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex re fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas noctes tecum epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:43" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:165" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus primae pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:138" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 138</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sibi ex ista laude centurio decerpit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12467.5" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to carpo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (invidia) spes tantas decerpat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § 10; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illibatam virginitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
decerptor: <entryFree id="n12468" type="main" key="de_cerptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcerptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decerpo</etym>, <sense id="n12468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who plucks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excerpts</hi>. Only <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who extracts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quotes</hi>: auctori tribui quod decerptori debui, August. c. Sec. Jul. 1, 16.</sense></entryFree>
decertatio: <entryFree id="n12469" type="main" key="de_certa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcertātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decerto</etym>, <sense id="n12469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the decision of a dispute, a decisive conflict</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 7, 20, 2, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decertator: <entryFree id="n12470" type="main" key="de_certa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcertātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who goes through a decisive contest, a champion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 3, 16</bibl></cit> and 34.</sense></entryFree>
decerto: <entryFree id="n12471" type="main" key="de_certo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-certo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n12471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to go through a decisive contest, to fight it out</hi> (but certare, <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi>, without reference to the result. But the difference was not strictly observed. Thus Caesar uses often —15 times—<hi rend="ital">decertare</hi>, but never <hi rend="ital">certare;</hi> Sallust only the latter; and Cicero the two indifferently; cf.: decerno, I. B. and <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. inf.). </sense><sense id="n12471.1" n="I" level="1"> In the milit. sphere. </sense><sense id="n12471.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 50, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 77, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 81, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliis cum acerrimis nationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum civibus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so ferro in ultima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu cum mare (aries),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12471.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Pompeium) pari condicione belli secum decertare cogeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 78, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so cum toto exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:7:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum paratum esse decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 9</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 18, 36</bibl>: de salute omnium, Auct. B. Alex. 16, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duobus ducibus de imperio in Italia decertatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 16, 6; Auct. B. Afr. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n12471.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> like certo (v. h. v, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>) as <hi rend="ital">v. a., to fill with strife</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contention, to fight for, to achieve by fighting, contending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna profanis decertata odiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis decertata aequora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decertati labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Artemisia certamen laudibus ejus dicundis facit ... ad eas laudes decertandas venisse dicuntur viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12471.5" n="II" level="1"> Beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to contend</hi>: erat non jure, non legibus, non disceptando decertandum; <cit><quote lang="la">armis fuit dimicandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 36</bibl></cit>: decertare contentione dicendi, <hi rend="ital">to contend, to strive, to vie</hi> with one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta contentione cum consulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">and, inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint duo genera decertandi, unum per disceptationem, alterum per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit>; in the gymnasium, ludicra virginum inter se <pb n="519" /> <cb n="DECE" /> decertantium, Mela, 1, 7, 4.—* </sense><sense id="n12471.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of inanimate subjects: Africus Decertans Aquilonibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decervicatus: <entryFree id="n12472" type="hapax" key="de_cervi_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cervīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cervix</etym>, <sense id="n12472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">decollated, beheaded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
decessio: <entryFree id="n12473" type="main" key="de_cessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decedo</etym>, <sense id="n12473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away, departure</hi> (opp. accessio—good prose). </sense><sense id="n12473.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12473.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">is mecum saepe de tua mansione aut decessione communicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12473.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n12473.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The withdrawal, retirement</hi> of a magistrate from the province he has governed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12473.5" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">the decrease, diminution, abatement</hi>, or entire <hi rend="ital">disappearance</hi> of an object: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ulla decessio fieri poterat neque accessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum accessionem decumae an decessionem de summa fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 30 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decessio capitis aut accessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessio et decessio febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12473.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Decease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juliani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Did. Jul. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— * </sense><sense id="n12473.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: verborum, <hi rend="ital">the transition, transferring</hi> of words from their primary to a derivative meaning, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decessor: <entryFree id="n12474" type="main" key="de_cessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decedo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2</etym>, <sense id="n12474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who retires from a province he has governed;</hi> hence, with reference to his successor, <hi rend="ital">a retiring officer</hi> (rare): successori decessor invidit, Cic. Scaur. Fragm. § 33, p. 187 ed. Beier; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12474.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a predecessor in office</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psal. 43, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
decessus: <entryFree id="n12475" type="main" key="de_cessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>decedo</etym>, <sense id="n12475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away, departure</hi> (opp. accessus—good prose). </sense><sense id="n12475.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">post Dionysii decessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12475.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n12475.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The withdrawal, retirement</hi> of a magistrate from the province he has governed (in Cic. oftener decessio): <cit><quote lang="la">post M. Bruti decessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38</bibl></cit>; so Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12475.4" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">decrease, disappearance, departure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestūs,</quote> <trans><tr>the ebbing, subsidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12475.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Decease, death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum decessu plerique angi solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: EX DECESSV L. CAESARIS, Cenot. Pis. ap. Orell. Inscr. 643.</sense></entryFree>
decet: <entryFree id="n12476" type="main" key="de^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcet</orth>, <itype>cuit, 2</itype>, <sense id="n12476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers</hi>. [Sanscr. dacas, fame; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">doke/w</foreign>, to seem, think; Lat. decus, dignus]. <hi rend="ital">It is seemly, comely, becoming,; it beseems, behooves, is fitting, suitable, proper</hi> (for syn. v. debeo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">decere quasi aptum esse consentaneumque tempori et personae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. also nunc quid <hi rend="ital">aptum sit</hi>, hoc est, quid <hi rend="ital">maxime deceat</hi> in oratione videamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 210</bibl> (very freq. and class.; not in Caes.).—Constr., with <case>nom.</case> or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> of the thing, and with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> less freq. with <case>dat.</case> of the pers.; sometimes <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi></sense><sense id="n12476.1" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">nom. rei</hi> </sense><sense id="n12476.2" n="(a)" level="5"> and <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.: Ph.</hi> Quin me aspice et contempla, ut haec (sc. vestis) me decet. Sc. Virtute formae id evenit, te ut deceat, quicquid habeas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 16 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem decet muliebris ornatus, quem incessus psaltriae, Cic. Clod. fragm. 5, p. 105 ed. Beier: te toga picta decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:53 al" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 4, 53 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and nec habitus triumphalis feminas deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Aristippum color decuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonsus crinis deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neglecta decet multas coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 106</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">id maxime quemque decet, quod est cujusque maxime suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnes et semper et ubique decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si quid Pholoen satis, Et te, Chlori, decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 15, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui flexus deceat miserationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem quis deceat status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 29, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tenues decuere togae nitidique capilli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te non citharae decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 3, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba decent Cererem: vestes Cerealibus albas Sumite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:619" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 619</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 457</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec velle experiri, quam se aliena deceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quoque diversa bonum virum decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 42</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">duo verba uni apposita ne versum quidem decuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12476.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est difficilius quam quid deceat videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid deceat et quid aptum sit personis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus singularis magis decuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DECI" /> 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 161</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">idem fere in omni genere causarum et proderit et decebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 21</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lepos, joci, risus, vinum, ebrietas decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magna pars est exhausta orationis, pene omnia decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:147" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:150" default="NO">150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 48</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n12476.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc facinus nostro generi non decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 188</bibl></cit>: certa est ratio quae deceat philosopho, Apul. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3, p. 355:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, p. 355, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; cf. infra. —</sense><sense id="n12476.5" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12476.6" n="(a)" level="5"> and <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te mihi irasci decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc maculam nos decet effugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem irasci minime decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 265</bibl>; so freq. with <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">specimen naturae capi debet ex optima quaque natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalin' decuit violari vulnere divum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 797</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12476.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusta ab justis impetrare non decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplis grandioribus decuit uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc decet caput impedire myrto: nunc et in umbrosis Fauno decet immolare lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 4, 9 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12476.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet tantae majestati eas servare leges, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita uti liberali esse ingenio decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima certe pensari decet populo utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 58, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12476.9" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n12476.10" n="(a)" level="5"> with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut vos decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facis, ut te decet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita uti fortes decet milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Andr. 2, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12476.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Without case: <cit><quote lang="la">eia haud sic decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti ut decuerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus severe quam decuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velata parte oris, quia sic decebat,</quote> <trans><tr>it was becoming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aliter ac deceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: perge; <cit><quote lang="la">decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 153</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12476.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nobis decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum editiorem quam victoribus decebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 98</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 127</bibl>.)— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (freq. in Hor., Ov., and post-Aug. prose, esp. Quint.; not in Verg.; in Cic. once adverbially, and cf. <hi rend="ital">decentia</hi>), <hi rend="ital">seemly, becoming, decent, proper, fit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 5, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decentior amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and sinus (togae) decentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 13, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis decens et accommodatus orationi motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and allevatio atque contractio humerorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decentissimum sponsalium genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid verum atque decens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decentius erit servare pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. 8, 6, 6.—</sense><sense id="n12476.13" n="2" level="3"> Esp. of corporeal fitness and symmetry, <hi rend="ital">regularly, symmetrically, handsomely shaped; well-formed; noble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus decentior quam sublimior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 27, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:8:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 8, 52</bibl></cit> (5, 8, 52 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">Gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Paullus) et nobilis et decens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: pulcher et decens toto corpore, Suct. Dom. 18; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptis decentior armis Minerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">decenter</orth> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1), <hi rend="ital">becomingly, decently, properly, fitly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictis nominibus decenter uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula quaeque locum teneant sortita decenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 44</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:21 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 21 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, a false reading for diligentissime, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caes. 26, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decetia: <entryFree id="n12477" type="main" key="De^cetia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcetia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Aedui in</hi> Gallia Celtica, now <hi rend="ital">Decize</hi>, on the Loire, in the Départ. de la Nièvre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decharmido: <entryFree id="n12478" type="main" key="de_charmi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcharmĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de-Charmides</etym>, <sense id="n12478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to un-Charmidize</hi>, i. e. to destroy one's identity as Charmides, also (with allusion to etym. of Charmides, "Son of joy," from <foreign lang="greek">xa/rma</foreign>) to end his happiness: <cit><quote lang="la">rursum te decharmida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decianus: <entryFree id="n12479" type="main" key="De^ci^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Decius, <sense id="n12479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12480" type="main" key="De^ci^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Cic. Rab. perd. 9, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 32, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deciates: <entryFree id="n12481" type="main" key="Decia_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Deciātes</orth>, <itype>um or ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people</hi> <cb n="DECI" /> <hi rend="ital">of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: oppidum Deciatum, Mela, 2, 5, 3.</sense></entryFree>
decidius: <entryFree id="n12482" type="main" key="De_^ci^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dē^cĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, esp. L. Decidius Saxa, <hi rend="ital">a military officer who served under Caesar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
decido: <entryFree id="n12483" type="main" key="de_ci^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cado</etym>, <sense id="n12483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall off, fall down</hi> (class.).</sense><sense id="n12483.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12483.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">decido de lecto praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">anguis decidit de tegulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma ex arboribus decidunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e flore guttae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which ex equo (in terram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ab equo (in arva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:259" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:350" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbore glandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 164</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terras imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 497</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsae turres graviore casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">montium decidentium moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(volucris) decidit in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 569</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in terras sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:847" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in puteum foveamve auceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacum fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dolia serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:432" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in casses praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laqueos suos auceps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rem. Am. 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in turbam praedonum hic fugiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12483.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. (like cado and concido), <hi rend="ital">to fall down dead, to sink down, to die</hi> (in class. Lat. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">morbo decidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ubi decidimus, Quo pater Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor abhinc annos centum qui decidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidit exanimis vitamque reliquit in astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 517</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:125" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 125</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 755</bibl>: (nupta) Decidit; <cit><quote lang="la">in talum serpentis dente recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12483.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall, drop, fall away, fail, sink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta de spe decidi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which quanta spe decidi!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and a spe societatis Prusiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit> (cf.: astrum, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ego ab archetypo labor et decido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo decidit ut exsul de senatore fieret,</quote> <trans><tr>has fallen so low</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: oculis captus in hanc fraudem decidisti (cf. <foreign lang="greek">katapi/ptein</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eas rei familiaris angustias decidit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc decidisse cuncta, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta omnia celeriter tamquam flosculi decidunt,</quote> <trans><tr>perish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non virtute hostium sed amicorum perfidia decidi,</quote> <trans><tr>am fallen, defeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an toto pectore deciderim,</quote> <trans><tr>wholly banished from her affections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)k qumou= pese/ein</foreign>, Hom. Il. 23, 595): <cit><quote lang="la">qui huc deciderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>into this illness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hydropa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: in maximis necessitatibus, ad quas libidine deciderat, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12484" type="main" key="de_ci_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n12484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare in ante-Aug. per.; more freq. abscīdo; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Caes.): taleas oleaginas tripedaneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:45" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgam arbori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">prov.: pennas,</quote> <trans><tr>to clip the wings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filicem nascentem falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:389" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 389</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12484.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cudgel, beat soundly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verberibus decidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:21:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n12484.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to decide</hi> a disputed, or, indeed, any matter (qs. to cut the knot; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimo and secare lites, res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sat. 1, 10, 15</bibl>); <hi rend="ital">to determine, settle, terminate, put an end to</hi> (class., most freq. in judic. lang.; cf.: transigo, paciscor). </sense><sense id="n12484.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: damnum, XII. Tab. 12, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:37" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:45" default="NO">4, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus actis atque decisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decisa negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res transactione decisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and jam decisa quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidis statuisque tu, quid iis ad denarium solveretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:63" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 63</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:22:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 4, 22, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc loco praeter nomen cetera propriis decisa sunt verbis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>decidedly, clearly expressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: ego pol istam jam aliquovorsum tragulam decidero, <hi rend="ital">I will now dispose of this dart one way or another</hi>, i. e. I will now put an end to this attack, these tricks, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 2, 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12484.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">praepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>, § <pb n="520" /> <cb n="DECI" /> 79; 2, 1, 48, § 125; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 40, 41, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erit uncia tota, decidat tecum qua pater ipse deum,</quote> <trans><tr>for which Jupiter may compound with you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum patrono pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:26:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 26, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:35 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 35 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 7</bibl>: decidere jactu coepit cum ventis, <hi rend="ital">to compound with the winds by throwing overboard</hi> (the cargo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12484.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jugera singula ternis medimnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:de Vir. Ill. 56:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> de Vir. Ill. 56, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12484.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cut down, reduce, diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tertiam partem vectigal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deciduus: <entryFree id="n12485" type="main" key="de_ci^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. decĭdo</etym>, <sense id="n12485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falling down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off, deciduous</hi> (chiefly in Pliny: folia, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:92" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 24, 38, § 92</bibl> (where Freund assumes decīdua, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R.
