R. 5, 7</bibl>, but without necessity): <cit><quote lang="la">(ignes) decidui ad terras fulminum nomen habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <trans><tr>falling, shooting stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes pecori ad crura decidui, subus annexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decies: <entryFree id="n12486" type="main" key="de^ci^e_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭēs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭens</orth>, <sense id="n12486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [decem], <hi rend="ital">ten times</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12486.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae decies anno pariunt, quaedam et undecies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decies seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:163" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. decies centena milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit> Zumpt. More commonly <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> decies: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. decies et octingenta milia, i. e. 1,800,000 sesterces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra trecenta milia usque ad decies aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam sestertii decies in aerarium retulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:77:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 77, § 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12486.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an indefinite large number</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 294</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 136</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">decies centena dedisses Huic parco, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:335" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 335</bibl>; Catul. 23, 20.</sense></entryFree>
decima: <entryFree id="n12487" type="main" key="de^ci^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. decimus, <sense id="n12487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. and II. B.</sense></entryFree>
decimanus: <entryFree id="n12488" type="main" key="de^ci^ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmānus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmānus</orth> (v. decimus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decimus</etym>, <sense id="n12488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the tenth part.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12488.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n12488.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of tithes</hi>, as a tax: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans><tr>that pays tithes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a tithe of the produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> and 81: oleum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 445, 19</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12488.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a farmer of tithes, tithe-gatherer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 8</bibl> et saep.: (perh. sarcastically) <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of a tithefarmer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which decumana mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12488.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of the tenth cohort</hi>: miles, Auct. B. Afr. 16, 2; and oftener <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 1; Auct. B. Hisp. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl>.—Esp.: porta decumana, the main entrance of a Roman camp, placed the farthest from the enemy (because the tenth cohort of each legion was there encamped), opposite the <hi rend="ital">porta praetoria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 23</bibl>; Smith's Ant. p. 222, a.—</sense><sense id="n12488.5" n="C" level="2"> Decumanus limes, in agriculture, <hi rend="ital">a boundary line drawn from east to west</hi>, opp. <hi rend="ital">cardo</hi> (v. h. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:337" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 34, 77, § 337</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 14</bibl>; v. Wordswörth, Fragm. p. 446.— </sense><sense id="n12488.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">considerable, large, immense</hi> (cf.: decimus, decem, decies, etc.): accipensere, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>: DECUMANA ova' dicuntur et DECUMANI fluctus, quia sunt magna, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
decimarius: <entryFree id="n12489" type="main" key="de^ci^ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., pertaining to tithes</hi>: leges, Cod. 8, 58.—</sense><sense id="n12489.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Paying tithes, subject to tithes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 128</bibl>, Serm. 8, 4 al.</sense></entryFree>
decimatio: <entryFree id="n12490" type="main" key="de^ci^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>decimo</etym>, <sense id="n12490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the taking of a tenth</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12490.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tithing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tobiae, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12490.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A selecting by lot of every tenth man for punishment, decimation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12490.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tenth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc in ea decimatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decimatrus: <entryFree id="n12491" type="gloss" key="de^ci^ma_trus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmātrus</orth>, <sense id="n12491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holiday of the Falisci, ten days after the Ides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257, 6</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
decimo: <entryFree id="n12492" type="main" key="de^ci^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>decimus</etym>. <sense id="n12492.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To select by lot every tenth man for punishment, to decimate</hi> (postAug., although the practice itself occurs as <cb n="DECI" /> early as 283 A. U. C.; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: cohortium militem, Frontin. Strat. 4, 1, 37 al.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12492.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to pay tithes, to collect tithes from</hi> a person. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Levi decimatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12492.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To select the tenth part as an offering, to pay tithes of</hi> anything, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237:25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237, 25</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Matth. 23, 23</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., selected, excellent, choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:49" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 49</bibl></cit> and 51.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 8:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decimodia: <entryFree id="n12493" type="main" key="de^ci^mo^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmŏdĭa</orth>, v. decemmodius.</entryFree>
decimus: <entryFree id="n12494" type="main" key="de^ci^mus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭmus</orth> (the latter form prevailed in the later law lang.; hence, decumanus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>decem with superl. ending</etym>, <sense id="n12494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tenth</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12494.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decima hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septuma (dies) post decumam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the seventeenth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 284</bibl></cit> Voss.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decumo efficit ager,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tenfold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl></cit>; so, extulisset, ib. § 113.—* </sense><sense id="n12494.2" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭmum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (like tertium, quartum, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">for the tenth time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12494.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕcĭma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dĕcŭma</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars), <hi rend="ital">the tenth part, tithe</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12494.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">As an offering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testatur Terentius Varro ... majores solitos decimam Herculi vovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 54</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 7</bibl>; cf. with pars; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 874</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi (sc. Pythico Apollini) hinc decumam partem praedae voveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vovissent Apollini decumas praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. of the tithes given by the Hebrews to support the priesthood,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 18, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12494.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A largess openly bestowed by public men on the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oresti nuper prandia in semitis decumae nomine magno honori fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12494.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tithe, as a tax on landholders in the provinces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:10:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 10, § 25</bibl>; more freq. in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 39</bibl>, § 89 sq.—</sense><sense id="n12494.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tithe, as conveyed by last will</hi>: decimas uxoribus dari, Trach. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 19</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n12494.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (like decem, decies, etc.), <hi rend="ital">considerable, large, immense</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vastius insurgens decimae ruit impetus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 530</bibl></cit> (cf.: decimanus, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II., and in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">trikumi/a</foreign>); <cit><quote lang="la">so of billows,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:122" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:54" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 54</bibl> (decimus by circumlocut.: qui venit hic fluctus, fluctus supereminet omnes; <cit><quote lang="la">posterior nono est undecimoque prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:50" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12495" type="main" key="De^ci^mus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proper names</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12495.1" n="I" level="1"> Decimus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman praenomen</hi>, abbrev. D. In the gens Claudia it was given only to patricians; but among the Junii and Laelii to plebeians also; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 61</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭmiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., named for Decimus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pirus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12495.2" n="II" level="1"> Decima, <hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over accouchements</hi>, a partus tempestivi tempore, Varr. and Caesel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 10 sq.</bibl>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Val. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decineratus: <entryFree id="n12496" type="main" key="de_ci^ne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcĭnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>de-cinis</etym>, <sense id="n12496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wholly turned to ashes</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decineresco: <entryFree id="n12497" type="main" key="de_ci^ne^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cĭnĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be wholly reduced to ashes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullo igni decinerescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
decipio: <entryFree id="n12498" type="main" key="de_ci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, primarily signifies to catch away, catch up, seize an animal while running, fleeing, etc. (whence decipula, a snare, trap); but occurs only in the trop. sense (acc. to capio, <sense id="n12498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.), <hi rend="ital">to catch, ensnare, entrap, beguile, elude, deceive, cheat</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudo, emungo, circumscribo, circumvenio, frustror, verba do, impono, fallo): fiunt transennae ubi decipiuntur dolis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 9 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita decipiemus fovea lenonem Lycum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 1, 1, 268</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo deceptum, quod neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Roscius novem homines honestissimos ... induxit, decepit, omni fraude et perfidia fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa amphibolia, quae Croesum decepit, vel Chrysippum potuisset fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 17 al.</bibl>: homines imperitos et per colloquium deceptos crudelissime interfecisse, Caes. B. <cb n="DECL" /> C. 1, 85, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">so per aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 82</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nullo verbo eum memoria decepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl></cit>. Praef. 18: <cit><quote lang="la">jam semel in prima spe deceptos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which spe affinitatis deceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deceptus nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidine falso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorem amicae decipiunt vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in Gr. construction: Prometheus dulci laborum decipitur sono, <hi rend="ital">is beguiled of his sufferings</hi> (i. e. forgets his sufferings, being beguiled with sweet melody), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 13, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12498.1" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationibus decipiendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo opinio decipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 346</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 431</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatile pecus facile custodiam pastoris decipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 3, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specimen istud virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tamen absumo decipioque diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:114" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 55</bibl> Loers.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 4, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo vinum potantem decipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,043:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Hab. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12498.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">victima deceptus decipientis ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab tergo et super caput decepere insidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decipula: <entryFree id="n12499" type="main" key="de_ci^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcĭpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>decipio</etym>, <sense id="n12499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snare, gin, trap.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12499.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">plena avibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jerem. 5, 27</bibl></cit>; Job 18, 10.—</sense><sense id="n12499.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n12499.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job 18, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12499.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 250, 28; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, p. 360</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: nulla decipula, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decircino: <entryFree id="n12500" type="main" key="de_circi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-circĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make of a circular form, to round off</hi> (only in Manil.): <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 352</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decisio: <entryFree id="n12501" type="main" key="de_ci_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. decīdo</etym>. <sense id="n12501.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to decīdo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.) <hi rend="ital">A diminishing</hi>: luminis, App. de Mundo, p. 71, 4.—Far more freq., and in good prose.—</sense><sense id="n12501.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to decīdo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.) <hi rend="ital">A decision, settlement, agreement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra de aequitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicat decisionem factam esse, quae facta non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 36, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
decisus: <entryFree id="n12502" type="main" key="de_ci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. 2, decīdo.</entryFree>
decitans: <entryFree id="n12503" type="hapax" key="de_ci^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>de-cĭto</etym>, <sense id="n12503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing to glide down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decius: <entryFree id="n12504" type="main" key="De^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭus</orth>, a. <sense id="n12504.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient Italian praenomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decius Magius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12504.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an eminent plebeian</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">at Rome</hi>. Its bestknown members were the two Decii (P. Decius Mus, father and son), who, as consuls, voluntarily devoted themselves to death to save their country (the former, in the Latin war, at Veseris, B.C. 340, the latter, in the Samnite war, at Sentinum, B.C. 295), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 27</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:5" default="NO">5, 6, 5</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:7" default="NO">1, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:62" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 62</bibl> (4, 10, 62 M.). —<hi rend="ital">Genit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 45. Cicero also mentions the grandson, who devoted himself at Asculum in the war against Pyrrhus, B.C. 279, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12504.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Decius</hi>, lex, <hi rend="ital">of P. Decius Mus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12504.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Decius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus (i. e. of the second Decius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12504.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An artist at Rome</hi>, B.C. 56, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
declamatio: <entryFree id="n12505" type="main" key="de_cla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>declamo</etym>. <sense id="n12505.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Exercise in oratorical delivery, exercise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practice in speaking, declamation</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Quint.): cum sit declamatio forensium actionum meditatio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quotidiana declamatione utilis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12505.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">a theme, subject for declamation</hi>, called also <hi rend="ital">causa</hi> (v. h. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:12" default="NO">10, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO">10, 5, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also of a person who serves as a theme, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12505.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">loud, eager talking, bawling</hi> (so several times in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">desinamus aliquando vulgari et pervagata declamatione contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>: sequitur ut materiae abhorrenti a veritate, declamatio adhibeatur, <pb n="521" /> <cb n="DECL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non placet mihi inquisitio candidati, non declamatio potius quam persalutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
declamatiuncula: <entryFree id="n12506" type="main" key="de_cla_ma_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclāmātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>declamatio</etym>, <sense id="n12506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little exercise in speaking, a short declamation</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
declamator: <entryFree id="n12507" type="main" key="de_cla_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclāmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>declamo</etym>, <sense id="n12507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who practises set speaking, a rhetorician, declaimer</hi> (diff. from <hi rend="ital">orator</hi>, a practical speaker, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 21</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">non enim declamatorem aliquem de ludo aut rabulam de foro, sed doctissimum et perfectissimum quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 34, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:51" default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:42" default="NO">5, 13, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 23</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
declamatorius: <entryFree id="n12508" type="main" key="de_cla_ma_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclāmātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>declamator</etym>, <sense id="n12508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the exercise of speaking, declamatory, rhetorical</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illo genere duci et delectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ef.: genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclāmātōriē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a rhetorical manner</hi> (late Lat.), Hieron. al.</sense></entryFree>
declamito: <entryFree id="n12509" type="main" key="de_cla_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclāmĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.</hi>, freq. <gen>n.</gen> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [declamo], <hi rend="ital">to practise rhetorical delivery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declamation, to declaim</hi> (good prose; most frequent in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12509.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n12509.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentabar declamitans (sic enim nunc loquuntur), saepe cum M. Pisone et cum Q. Pompeio aut cum aliquo cotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:310" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 310</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 15</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12509.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <trans><tr>to plead for the sake of practise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12509.4" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to talk violently, to bluster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
declamo: <entryFree id="n12510" type="main" key="de_cla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n12510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>— Rhetor. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to exercise one's self in rhetorical delivery, to practise speaking, to declaim</hi>. For syn. cf.: dictito, concionor, pronuntio, palam dico, praedico, recito, declamito. (Class., most freq. in Cic. and Quint.) </sense><sense id="n12510.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n12510.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fluctum aiunt declamare solitum Demosthenem, ut fremitum assuesceret voce vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; id. fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 73</bibl>: dum tu declamas Romae, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamare doces?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est sedes orationis, hic laus omnis declamantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 62</bibl></cit> (al. declamat) et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo, quomodo declametur, positum est etiam, quomodo agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12510.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; cf., on the contrary, declamito, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">suasorias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12510.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to speak oratorically, to declaim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nisi mentis inops tenerae declamet amicae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 465</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12510.5" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi> as an orator <hi rend="ital">with violence, to declaim, to bluster, bawl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille insanus, qui pro isto vehementissime contra me declamasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in quemvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex alia oratione declamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
declaratio: <entryFree id="n12511" type="main" key="de_cla_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclārātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>declaro</etym>, <sense id="n12511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evident, a disclosure, exposition, declaration</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">animi tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris tui?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eadem declaratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ps. 118, 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
declarativus: <entryFree id="n12512" type="main" key="de_cla_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclārātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for explanation, explanatory</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 30</bibl></cit> and 33; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 341</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclārā-tīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by way of explanation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 393</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
declarator: <entryFree id="n12513" type="main" key="de_cla_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclārātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who declares</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes known, an announcer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut honoribus nostris in campo declarator exsisteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:92:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 92, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
declaro: <entryFree id="n12514" type="main" key="de_cla_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-clāro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make clear, plain, evident</hi> (by disclosing, uncovering), <hi rend="ital">to show, manifest, declare</hi>, etc., <foreign lang="greek">a)pofai/nw</foreign> (class.; most freq. in the trop. sense). For syn. cf.: monstro, demonstro, probo, confirmo, ostendo, ostento, significo, indico, defero; exsisto, appareo, eluceo. —</sense><sense id="n12514.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12514.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentiam saepe divisuam declarant, ut et apud Regillum.... Castor et Pollux ex equis pugnare visi sunt, Cic. N: D. 2, 2, 6: dentibus (cervorum) senecta declaratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis nave declarata suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12514.3" n="B" level="2"> In pub. law lang., t. t., <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi> any one <cb n="DECL" /> in public session as elected to an office (esp. that of consul), <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proclaim publicly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem hominis voce et declaratus consul et defensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 2</bibl></cit> (for which shortly before, L. Murenam consulem <hi rend="ital">renunciavi</hi>); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">declaratus rex Numa de templo descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem, praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatum militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J, 63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J, 63, 4</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victorem magnā praeconis voce Cloanthum Declarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 245</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12514.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make clear to the mind, to manifest, demonstrate, prove, show, explain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot signis eadem natura declaret quid velit, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc., acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf., a relat. clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12514.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatibus avium et cantibus declarari res futuras putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:65:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 65, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa consolatio litterarum tuarum declarat summam benevolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarant gaudia vultu, * Catull. 64, 34 et saep.: propriam cujusque (generis juris civilis) vim definitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 190</bibl></cit>: nullum (verbum) inveniri potest, quod magis idem declaret Latine, quod Graece <foreign lang="greek">h(donh/</foreign>, quam declarat <hi rend="ital">voluptas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in like manner of the meaning of words,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 22, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ipsa per se declarant intellectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (litera C.) inversa mulierem declarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12514.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem catum eum esse declaramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:468" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 468</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plurimis locis perorationes nostrae voluisse nos atque animo contendisse declarant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl> prooem. § 15 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12514.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relative clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cujusque ingenium ut sit declarat maxume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut matres familiae eorum sortibus et vaticinationibus declararent, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui declaravit quanti me faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 7</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12514.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ratio declarat eorum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarant illae contiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 12 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
declinabilis: <entryFree id="n12515" type="main" key="de_cli_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclīnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>declino</etym>, <sense id="n12515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be</hi> (grammatically) <hi rend="ital">inflected</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 670</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
declinatio: <entryFree id="n12516" type="main" key="de_cli_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending from</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">a bending aside; an oblique inclination</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direction</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n12516.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanceam exigua corporis declinatione vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quot ego tuas petitiones parva quadam declinatione effugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinare dixit (Epicurus) atomum perpaulum, et ipsa declinatio ad libidinem fingitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; so of the <hi rend="ital">oblique motion</hi> of atoms, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12516.2" n="B" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kli/ma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the supposed slope of the earth towards the poles, a region of the earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sky, a climate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinatio mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § 22; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">positio caeli et declinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so correspond. with regio caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>the altitude of the pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12516.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12516.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a turning away from</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">an avoiding, avoidance</hi>: ut bona natura appetimus, sic a malis natura declinamus; <cit><quote lang="la">quae declinatio, si cum ratione fiet, cautio appelletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. appetitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; and in <number>plur.</number> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris, periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12516.5" n="B" level="2"> t. t. </sense><sense id="n12516.6" n="1" level="3"> Of rhetor. lang., <hi rend="ital">a short digression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinatio brevis a proposito, non ut superior illa digressio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 32</bibl> and 34.—</sense><sense id="n12516.7" n="2" level="3"> Of gramm. lang.: <hi rend="ital">variation, inflection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12516.8" n="(a)" level="5"> In the older grammarians, every change of form which a word undergoes; as <hi rend="ital">declension</hi>, strictly so called, <hi rend="ital">conjugation, comparison, derivation</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=2 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10:section=11" default="NO">10, § 11</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also of declension in its stricter sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:63" default="NO">1, 5, 63</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of conjugation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of derivation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4" default="NO">2, 15, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12516.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Among the later grammarians, of <hi rend="ital">declension</hi>, properly so called, as distinguished from conjugatio, comparatio, derivatio, etc. So, Donatus: in <hi rend="ital">declinatione</hi> compositivorum nominum, p. 174 P. (p. 13 Lind.).</sense></entryFree>
declinatus: <entryFree id="n12517" type="main" key="de_cli_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclīnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">variation, inflection</hi> of words (cf. the prec. art. II. B. <cb n="DECL" /> 2), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:51" default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:53" default="NO">53</bibl>. But in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 17</bibl>, the best reading is: declinatum dolorem, v. Madvig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
declinis: <entryFree id="n12518" type="main" key="de_cli_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclīnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turning aside</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. places): <cit><quote lang="la">declinia juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:297" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 297</bibl></cit> (quae declinarent et fugerent, Schol.). So of the retreating motion of the sea in ebb and flood: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>ebbing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 427</bibl></cit> dub. (al. declivibus).</sense></entryFree>
declino: <entryFree id="n12519" type="main" key="de_cli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-clīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>CLINO = <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign></etym>, orig. <sense id="n12519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend from</hi> the straight path; <hi rend="ital">to turn aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12519.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12519.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego modo declinavi paullum me extra viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sese rectā regione viai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 250</bibl></cit>; and: se a terris omnia numina, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina, Catull. 64, 91: agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares in alteram partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">to bend down</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lower, close</hi> them in sleep: nec dulci declinat lumina somno, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 185</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12519.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum ad dexteram de via declinavi, ut ad Pericli sepulcrum accederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 20, 8</bibl>.—So of the oblique motion of atoms (corresp. with oblique ferri): si omnes atomi declinabunt, nullae umquam cohaerescent; <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliae declinabunt, aliae suo nutu recte ferentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl> (preceded by cur Epicurus atomos <hi rend="ital">de via deducat</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae nova causa in natura est, qua declinet atomus? 20, 46 (the reading quae declinet atomum is wrong),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12519.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12519.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12519.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to turn aside</hi>: neque (mulierem) declinatam quicquam ab aliarum ingenio ullam reperias, <hi rend="ital">who has departed, deviated</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam verborum flgurae paulum figuris sententiarum declinantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque spe, neque metu declinatus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato literas Graecas aetate jam declinata didicit,</quote> <trans><tr>in the decline of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12519.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to turn aside, deviate, turn away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de statu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a religione officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a malis (opp. appetere bona),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a parvis delictis diligentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantulum a proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a recto itinere (oratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:14 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 14 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma paulum declinans a topazio in aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>passing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo revocetur unde huc declinavit oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>digressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in Italiam declinaverat belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in asperam Pholoen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad discendum jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinasse me paululum et praesentes fluctus fugisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim amor,</quote> <trans><tr>decreases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies coeperat declinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 9, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12519.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. grammat. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to vary, inflect</hi> a part of speech. </sense><sense id="n12519.9" n="1" level="3"> In the older grammarians, of every kind of inflection (declension, conjugation, comparison, derivation, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=2 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10:section=11" default="NO">10, § 11</bibl> sq.; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:63 al" default="NO">1, 5, 63 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n12519.10" n="2" level="3"> In the later grammarians, <hi rend="ital">to decline</hi>, in the strict sense, Charis, p. 8 sq. et al. —</sense><sense id="n12519.11" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with an object denoting that from which one turns aside; <hi rend="ital">to avoid, to shun</hi> (classical, most freq. in Cic.); <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis recte (oratio) declinat impetum, nisi etiam in cedendo quid deceat intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, corresp. with vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueos judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appetuntur quae secundum naturam sunt, declinantur contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae nocitura videantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudicitiam uxoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida ut busta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
declivis: <entryFree id="n12520" type="main" key="de_cli_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-clīvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n12520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. n.</hi> declivum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psal. 16, 5</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> once heterocl. decliva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 206</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also declivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. acclivis and aplustre), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clivus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">inclining downwards, sloping</hi> (for syn. cf.: devexus, praeruptas, abruptus, abscisus, proclivis, acclivis, propensus, praeceps, pronus.—Class. and freq., esp. in histt. and poets; perh. not in Cic. and Verg.). </sense><sense id="n12520.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">collis ab summo aequaliter declivis ad flumen Sabim,</quote> <trans><tr>sloping regularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in declivi et praecipiti loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: iniquo<pb n="522" /> <cb n="DECO" />  loco et leviter declivi, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 83, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus tenui fastigio vergebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, also vallis, and opp. mons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo, quem locum Catabathmon incolae appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum Aesulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 591</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 399</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus (amnium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 432</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 410</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sol in occasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12520.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">declive</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a declivity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de locis superioribus haec declivia et devexa cernebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per declive sese reciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 51, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erat per declive receptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 206</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12520.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur occiduae per iter declive senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 227</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier aetate declivis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the decline of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae in vitia,</quote> <trans><tr>prone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> perh. only: <cit><quote lang="la">dies ad occasum declivior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 19, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclīvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a sloping manner</hi>, only in <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declivius: incumbens rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 12, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
declivitas: <entryFree id="n12521" type="main" key="de_cli_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēclīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>declivis</etym>, <sense id="n12521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sloping place, declivity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
decocta: <entryFree id="n12522" type="main" key="de_cocta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēcocta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. decoquo, II. 2.</entryFree>
